Review: the gym itself i cant fault. very clean, to a good standard and well maintained.  however, take caution if you are considering hiring one of the pts there (i wont say who, due to it being there being an ongoing investigation regarding this pt).  the pt i hired promised, for ¬£233 a month, 8 sessions and a fitness plan i could follow. however, this was not delivered. the in-person sessions completely contradicted the online sessions set, the diet plan was completely off from what i needed, the supplements didnt match to watch i stipulated (i told the pt i couldnt take creatine, yet the diet plan heavily relied on it) and i ended up with several injuries as a result of the exercises set-the reason i hired a pt was so i could recover from injuries, among other things.  the pt only delivered on 4 booked sessions, of the 8 promised. i met them for a 5th, however i wont count that one, he cancelled the booked one at short notice, and rearranged it for a time that was completely unsuitable. even though i attended, i only completed about half of it because i ended up with an injury, because he booked a running session the day after another running session, as the pt hadnt checked the online sessions he had set for me. i ended up not being able to rest my legs.  i didnt hear anything after that from the pt for over a week. i was surprised to find the pt had charged me for another month, with no direct debit set up, no subscription agreement set up, nor had the pt asked whether i wanted another month. the pt hadnt delivered on one months worth of sessions.  were now nearly 3 weeks since i had the money taken out, and the pt has still to book a session or even contact me. the clearly never intended on delivering a session this month.  ive tried contacting puregym, and making them aware of the situation. the pt is still operating at the gym, and the issue is still not resolved. i havent really heard from anyone, beyond the odd email to state they were aware. im not the sort to publicly shame, and i was prepared to give the gym time to resolve this issue. however, as i havent heard anything, i dont have much of a choice.

3. refund/delivery issues To answer this question, I will stop here.

Review Title: Poor gym etiquette, Norwich Aylsham Road
Review: the gym itself is okay, could benefit from an extra leg machine (e.g.: hack squat) and a better calf raise machine (e.g.: standing straight leg). lockers are only outside changing rooms which was annoying at the start but i got used to it after a couple of months.  the biggest issue i have with this gym is the fact that most of the equipment always has plates on it. most people do not bother putting weights back. i have been to a large number of other gyms in norwich (including other puregym in castle mall), other cities and countries, and ive never seen it that bad. the culture in this gym is really poor, and the management needs to do something about it, there are ways to encourage/remind of positive and responsible behaviour. as of now, a lot of people have zero respect for the place, the equipment, and the people who will be using said equipment after theyre done. imagine your young sister or (grand)mother joining the gym and not being able to use half of the machines because they got 20/25kg plates all over which they cannot remove themselves safely. really, really poor.

Review Title: Rude manager, even worse from the PTs...
Review: ive been a member here for over two years now, and all i can say is that thankfully there is finally another option opening in the area in the next few weeks. the kit is ok, even if the placement of the kit is very poor. as a gym, its fine and does what youd expect. my issue is the staff. ive seen the manager several times a week since i joined, and he hasnt once even acknowledged me or said as much as hello, the same can be said for the previous assistant manager. the majority of the personal trainers are the same. no interaction, no welcome, not even a smile. some even go as far as dirty looks when they see you, and ive overheard them even insulting and making fun of members. i made this complaint when asked to leave a review some time ago, and all i got was an email telling me i was wrong. this is exactly the kind of place that gives gyms such a bad name, the ignorance of the staff and personal trainers would be enough to put off a new gym goer.

Review Title: Not worth the price & lack of customer service
Review: i was so excited about puregym opening as it‚Äôs a 2 minute walk from my house and i can quickly go home and shower and go straight to work.  that was the only reason i joined as i was a member with the gym group and cannot fault their service.  the second reason i joined is they were having a promotional offer of ¬£16.99 ( if you joined before they opened ) for the first six months and then the price increases to ¬£32.99!  puregym need to rethink this price increase as members want value for money and they aren‚Äôt providing this.  for example: the constructed layout is small, and i expected a much bigger space for the price. there is too much wasted space and the deadlift rack could have been 6 instead of three and there are no mirrors by this area so you can‚Äôt see a side angle.  in addition the way the back extension has been positioned you can‚Äôt see a side angle as there is only one long mirror by the dumbbells and you don‚Äôt have a front view as it‚Äôs been placed in front of a pillar.  i discovered that the cable machines had the wrong stickers on each of the weights so if you thought you were choosing 2.3kg for example it was really 4.3kg. there should have been a sign informing members about this.  where the landline is positioned they have placed a carpet by the window / open doors so if it rains the water comes through and makes the carpet extremely wet.  i discovered this as i was using the landmine in a seated position and my tracksuit bottoms were soaked. i informed the manager and no sign was placed to inform other members.  whoever designed the gym left out critical elements. this gym is missing some key machines: biceps curl, triceps press, lat pulldown, lateral raise, calf press, hack squat and there is a very low amount of cardio machines for this price. for example there is only one upright bike.  there is a good amount of cable machines, but i couldn‚Äôt believe they don‚Äôt provide a cable straight bar which is the most used attachment for cable machines and a narrow grip landmine handle & row attachment. this is shocking. there is a good amount of functional stuff and that‚Äôs about it.  when puregym opened its doors to the public the first thing i was shocked about was the fact that the changing area, toilets/showers and lockers are all on the same floor and shared between men and women.  there aren‚Äôt enough lockers for members and they have also provided open shelves for people to put their possessions in which is ridiculous as there is a sign that says puregym can‚Äôt be held accountable for anything that goes missing. why didn‚Äôt they just provide more lockers?  my frustrations have increased as they opened on the 01/12/2023 and closed 13/12/2023 and didn‚Äôt send an email out to members telling us. i found out by going to the gym and seeing a sign saying the place has shut down due to a facilities issue and to use the closest gym to me.  this is a joke as the main reason i joined was the close proximity and the closest to me would be crouch hill, finsbury park or muswell hill which means an additional cost to pay for transport and the distance doesn‚Äôt work for me.  when i contacted customer service the only option i was given was to freeze my membership which i would have to pay ¬£6.99 for each month.  i find this preposterous as no emails have been sent out to update members as to when the gym will open again. i could pay ¬£6.99 to freeze my membership and they open tomorrow. we‚Äôve been told to just keep an eye out for an email. this is shocking.  the gym group never do this. they give you a timeframe and keep you updated constantly. if i‚Äôm made to pay to freeze my membership i‚Äôm cancelling my membership. i feel a lot of members will leave after the first six months as the price increase doesn‚Äôt reflect the quality of this gym.

Review Title: Update: And still the most foul-smelling Gym in Halifax!
Review: the puregym communications manager said this: (15 november 2023 email.) ‚Äúalthough we have been having issues with the air conditioning, there is still ventilation in the gym, which has been checked and confirmed as operational.‚Äù i went the gym on the 18thnovember, as i entered the pod, i could feel the heat from the gym and the stench was sickening. be truthful, the place stinks and has done for many months. fellow gym members are prepared to substantiate the claims made here if requested. at low levels, stale air is uncomfortable, but at higher levels, stale air can become unhealthy. breathing in unhealthy levels of stale air can cause skin irritation, headaches, and fatigue, and can be especially dangerous for individuals with underlying conditions like allergies or respiratory problems. this is a gymnasium in decline, but it is no good blaming gym personnel. start taking the health and safety of your customers seriously. disturbingly shocking!

Review Title: I only come here because of the lack of competition
Review: ¬£30 - thats how much my membership costs per month. the equipment is old, tired, squeaky & rusty. when something breaks, it takes weeks to be repaired & because theres just 1 of everything, more often than not you are left waiting for someone to finish. how foolish of me to assume when you made a huge deal about "were building you a better gym"& "upgrading your gym to bring a brand-new look and feel and the latest kit", that this would mean new equipment replacing old & a total refresh. nope, youve just gotten rid of some cardio equipment (keeping the various out of service treadmills in place) and adding a functional area in the cleared space. weight machines are now uncomfortably squeezed together - fantastic! the air con is patchy at best. its an oven in the summer and freezing in winter. the showers are tepid and in desperate need of upgrading. this morning, without any prior warning via social media or emails to members, the gents showers were closed for re-grouting - surely this has been planned for weeks, why couldnt you send a very simple email to advise the showers would be unavailable?! the only reason this gym is as busy as it is, is because theres no competition in the area. expect your memberships to plummet when snap fitness opens, because people will realise there are better alternatives.

Review: the worst customer service i have received in a long time. i recently joined the gym and wanted to change my direct debit date to my payday. so i emailed as the number for customer services doesnt work. bearing in mind i joined on the 27th of september and emailed on the 3rd of october to request my direct debit date change. i was sent an auto-response about receiving a response and never received one. i then tried to change the app and online but no good. the date now comes for the direct debt to be collected and it fails. i received an email about logging into my account and that i now have late fees and admin fees. i tried to log in and even respond to the email they provided to talk with customer services, but again no answer just the automated response asking me to log in to my account i tried this but now my account is blocked and i cannot log in. i am appalled by the lack of customer service i have received. if someone had simply done their job and responded to me all those weeks ago, as they tried to collect the direct debt at the end of october i wouldnt be in this situation. they also cancelled all my classes from the 27th october and i only found out through the app, no email correspondence.

Review Title: I had the unfortunate experience of‚Ä¶
Review: i had the unfortunate experience of being a member at pure gym, and i must say that the staff at this gym is good at most times however one staff in particular left me very disappointed and not pleased as i have typically had a good experience at other puregyms. its not often that i feel compelled to write a bad review, but my encounters with this staff member were consistently disappointing.  first and foremost, the customer service she provided was abysmal. she seemed disinterested and indifferent to the needs and concerns of the members. it was as if she were going through the motions without any genuine care for the people they were supposed to be serving. i never felt welcomed or valued as a member, which made my visits to the gym a truly underwhelming experience.  additionally, i found her be unprofessional in her behavior. there were instances of her engaging in personal conversations on her phone, often ignoring the needs of members who required assistance or had questions. its not unreasonable to expect a certain level of professionalism and courtesy from the staff at a fitness facility. additionally i overheard her a few times making fun of the members as theyve walked away making inappropriate comments and who is to say she hasnt done the same for me.  i am unable to get the woman name but she is the manager which makes it exceptionally worse she is a short middle aged african woman and i would like she be dealt with immediately as she is ruining the experience for us.

Review: my friend and i have just had the most disgraceful experience at the canary wharf gym. we booked onto the learn to lift session with what they call on their website ‚Äúa fitness coach‚Äù. the app told us to wait in the functional area, so we arrived there 10 minutes early.  at 18:05 - 5 minutes after the 30 minute class was meant to start, he saunters over and starts to go into the men‚Äôs changing room. another pt we spoke to earlier called him over and he looked at us and asked what we wanted. we explained we were there for his class. he then proceeds to look at us like a piece of dirt, and passively aggressively explain he‚Äôs been waiting by the tables at the entrance. we explain the app told us to wait at the functional area and he proceeds to say ‚Äúno, you need to wait at the tables you know what tables are, i was there that‚Äôs where you need to go‚Äù. his attitude and attempts to mansplain what a table was absolutely disgusting. he then goes to walk away and we asked whether he was taking the session. he said he would come back later.  this experience felt incredibly misogynistic and as two female gym goers has knocked our confidence in ever coming back to puregym if this is how women are treated. his attitude towards the very fact we weren‚Äôt waiting for him where he was, whilst we were in the right area, was disgusting. we‚Äôve cancelled our memberships as we don‚Äôt feel comfortable around him in the future.  the gym has asked me to remove his personal details so unfortunately other women gym goers can‚Äôt be warned about him. would be good to hear back from the manager on this incident but alas we‚Äôre still waiting.  edit: have seen the reply. the same reply i received on google and twitter. i got in touch with the manager previous to writing this review, still no response ‚Ä¶

Review Title: Terrible first visit not sure I‚Äôm returning
Review: today was my first day and really let down. recently started working in coventry but home is sutton coldfield. was going for the off peak membership as i wanted to do 6.30am classes before work but as i wanted both gyms had to pay the higher membership, which is fine. i got up at 5am today, got ready, drove to coventry to do the class i was booked onto. i was then told that as i was the only one booked on he cancelled the class!!! i asked if they had sent an email or message telling people and he just said no we don‚Äôt do that. i said i‚Äôd got up at 5am to get there and he just said ‚Äòoh right‚Äô and walked round pointing machines out to me. not exactly sure how that is acceptable as he is paid to be there and i‚Äôm paying to do the class. whether it is one person or twenty the class should be taught. so now im left having paid for this and not getting what i‚Äôve paid for. i only joined for the 6.30 classes as it‚Äôs the only time i have but am i now expected to turn up at 6.30am n hope that i might actually get what i‚Äôve paid for? really, really disappointed. it‚Äôs taken me so much to get in the right headspace to get back to the gym n having to work around my diary and split time between birmingham and coventry and getting up super early to do so, only to be let down. very bad service and not sure i‚Äôm going to go back. sad really. only expect the guy to do his job and what i‚Äôm paying for.  9/11/23 with regards to your response, yet again i‚Äôm am being shown the lack of interest in customer service or satisfaction. instead i‚Äôm being told to contact other people and (as you mention in your reply) it would be easier to include all my information. all the information is in the original review/email! i told u which gyms, what days, what time and you have my name! seriously how difficult can it be. this place is just making me more and more angry. stay away from puregym - you can see from start to finish the way things have been and how they‚Äôve been dealt with. dont waste your time and money!!

Review Title: Freezing cold changing room and shower
Review: the issue i am referring to pertains to the unreasonably cold temperature in the shower rooms designated for women. it appears that the air conditioning is continuously left on, resulting in an uncomfortable and unpleasant experience for gym members. the excessive coldness makes it challenging to have a refreshing and satisfactory shower, subsequently impacting our overall gym experience.  what concerns me the most is the dismissive attitude displayed by the staff when i have voiced my complaint. instead of actively addressing the issue, they have merely laughed and nodded in agreement, which is deeply disheartening. as a loyal and dedicated customer of pure gym, i believe that our concerns should be treated with utmost importance and professionalism.i kindly request that pure gym take immediate action to rectify this situation. it is essential that the air conditioning in the shower rooms is adjusted to ensure a comfortable environment for gym members. additionally, i urge pure gym to address the attitude of the staff towards customer complaints, emphasizing the importance of providing a supportive and respectful environment.

Review Title: PT - unprofessional, bullying and defensive text in response to feedback
Review: the pt i complained about and provided with feedback has contacted me directly with a long defensive and aggressive text message - distorting the truth to cover his own back. his text was made up of calling me names and distorted scenarios to protect himself - scenarios he has never mentioned until ive raised this complaint. the fact these scenarios were never documented or raised shows that this is a false narrative being used to protect himself.  this shows the inability to receive feedback and respond professionally. the professional and correct response wouldve been to apologise, raise it with his line manager or address the refund.  i have contacted the cluster manager again with a screenshot of his text messages. along with the truth about these false allegations hes using to justify his unjust behaviour.  i hope puregym deal with this unprofessionalism and bullying appropriately. i advise all members receive professional training on customer service, and diversity & inclusion (which covers discrimination and gender equality). i feel as though a lot of this was driven by x (pt) perceiving me as a young black woman he could take advantage of, and did not expect i would escalate appropriately.  i will continue to feedback any negative experiences from x or the general gym staff here and escalate to the regional manager - no paying customer should be treated this way, and i hope this doesnt happen again.

Review Title: No interest or help from staff member.?
Review: email sent twice to customer services and still waiting for response, nearly 4 weeks later ??? .......  dear sir/madam,  ive recently joined the puregym at westwood gateway retail park in broadstairs, kent on 2nd october. having not been to a gym for quite some time, i was both happy and excited to see that you offer a "get started " induction class, to help and demonstrate the facilities and safety at the branch. i booked this straight away for this weekend as i wanted to feel more confident when using the gym equipment. my booking information was confirmed in the week (please find attached)  i arrived approx 10 mins early but unfortunately, my pass code would not work for entrance to the gym. i managed to get help from another member who let me in and i was going to bring it up with the (staff member) during the induction.  she wasnt at the entrance as stated, so i took a seat on the nearby benches. about 3:10pm, nobody had arrived, despite saying there was only 2 spaces left on my booking. i gave it till about 3:20pm and went upstairs on the mezzanine, which i thought there maybe a staff member, but the offices were all shut. i rechecked my emails and it was definitely the right time/date.  i looked over to the corner of the gym and saw a lady with what looked like a puregym uniform on. i approached her and apologized for interrupting and asked her about the class. she replied with that she was (staff member) and the class should not of been booked as she doesnt work saturdays? she kept blaming the management for the mistake? i asked her what can i do, as id taken the afternoon off work to attend the class and she said you can try and book again for next weekend, but itll be no good as nobody works here at weekends??  i found her very strange and unhelpful as she was actually there working, despite saying she doesnt work on saturdays??  i left the gym feeling quite deflated and confused about the whole situation and lack of empathy from (staff member).  for this reason, i really would appreciate for you to arrange a refund on my opening account fund as i dont think i want to carry on with being a member of puregym. ive enclosed my receipt email for that too. please advise.  yours sincerely, sl  ive obviously not enclosed the staff members name as advised by trust pilot, but really disappointed about the whole situation and the fact the staff member was not interested in helping me in any way (ie) informing the gym manager or advising me of what to do ?
Generated Topics:
on with this gym.  i have attached my bank details for your convenience. 

1. Puregym at Westwood Gateway Retail

Review Title: The Pure gym business model is great.
Review: the pure gym business model is great.. however, as a paying customer, user, client even, i do not feel i get what i pay for, there are sometimes, several pieces of equipment out of commission, and they stay that way for days/weeks and even months, i totally appreciate, equipment, from time to time, will breakdown, need servicing etc, however, as a business, where by accessible, well maintained and functional equipment, equates to a better gym experience. the guys at park royal pure gym, who ever is in charge of the upkeep of all the equipment need to seriously get ontop of this, the multiple gym access, absolutely great and ideal for me and my lifestyle, however, visiting some pure gyms in east london, wow, absolutely disgusting, dishevelled changing room, equipment all over the place.. my gosh.. not naming (stratford) but man.. and can we do something about the unhealthy smell of certain people, like a promo body spray free give away.. i would love to be involved with that, istayfreshuk is a company that promotes freshness.. they sell bathrobes, mens underwear sets.. pure gym, you guys should contact them istayfreshuk "its not just a brand, its a lifestyle"

(two classes actually only work out 40mins in the hour. 2. max classes you can book is 8, which means i couldn‚Äôt book the week after, even though i was paying more.  to enter the gym you use you app pass to get in. well it wasn‚Äôt registering me correctly, so even though i was in class and got ticked of a paper registrar, they accused me of not turning up to class via email. consequently blocked me from booking classes and cancelled all my classes i had booked. i direct messaged the gym, they said they would fix it. 1 week later, i messaged again to say i still can‚Äôt book, i just got a response 9 days later (yesterday) saying please come in and we will try fix it again.  too late‚Ä¶ i‚Äôve already registered with another gym and cancelled.  also zumba, pilates, yoga is an extra cost. this is good to know before you join.  there was only one changing room in whole gym for the ladies and two showers (of which one started dribbling half way through and had to change to the other one to wash soap out of hair). they make it so small and hard work on purpose, so you won‚Äôt use the services.  the classes are a joke, non experienced instructors, disorganised, waste of time.

Review: i froze my membership one day before the direct debit was due to come out because i realised i could not afford to pay that month (cost of living crisis is hitting hard and im only on benefits due to being mentally and physically disabled). i checked to see any info saying it would take longer than that for the freeze to take place but could not see any. i was then charged ¬£45, which is the monthly fee + ¬£20 in late fees because the dd was unable to come out of my account. i asked for a refund since id tried my best to stop the dd coming out and since im clearly really struggling at the moment but received absolutely zero compassion or help in the reply. no empathy for a fellow human being struggling to eat now because the late fees i tried to avoid have taken me way out of budget. this has affected my mental health hugely and i cant believe there was literally zero compassion shown towards me for an honest mistake.

Review Title: When I chose to join puregym Muswell‚Ä¶
Review: when i chose to join puregym muswell hill, it was firstly and the main reason and still is the classes. the pts were very good and knowledgeable and made the classes enjoyable so much so that i was able to see the results of my hard work from the classes(im not that disciplined enough to train on my own) the problem is and has constantly been consistency of the classes and pts, i was doing 4  sometimes 5 or 6 classes a week 4 of them were after work monday to friday. as of today there is only 1 i can make (from the classes i did)and the pts of the classes when they was on, were not around long before they left. the others have either been stopped (due to no pt to take it) or the time has moved and im unable to attend. and as for the management well the latest manager (i dont actually know her name) stormed into the class before it started and told a client to go and put her coat in a locker as its a trip hazard which was fair enough but the way she said it well put it this way her people skills need a bit of working on.and iv never known a manager that doesnt actually take a class either.all iv seen since she has been the manager is puregym lose good pts and classes disappearing.

Review Title: Equipment is terrible worst gym I have trained in. ‚Ä¶
Review: equipment is basic which i understand for a corporate gym. the problem is there is so little of it. due to the high intake of clients it is broke often. at the moment broken equipment is cable machine, lumbar extension, leg press, leg extension. only 1 of each item so no other equipment to use the same. i have to now pay to go another gym at weekends to get a full training session. there is multiple treadmills broke. some equipment is dangerous as missing safety caps for eg pec dec. the equipment takes months to be fixed and loads of other equipment on its way out, completely rusted. air conditioning is turned off a lot of the time now in hot weather. tvs are not allowed to be switched on now. music was even off for a bit. worst gym to be in at present. very dirty in places. there is no action when feedback given by management at all and i have held back on a review for so long. it is so un motivating to train in. just lack of gyms in the area. no 24 hour ones either which is the only positive point i can give. looked for headquarters email and asked for contact details in the gym - none found or given. if you are into your fitness/weight training this is not for you. if you wanna go to chat or sit on your phone maybe it is. double your training time as queues for equipment as so little of it. in need of a total refurb. pure gym warrington and crewe are üíØ better with motivated staff so not all are as bad as northwich.

Review Title: A car crash of a gym being run to the ground
Review: puregym muswell hill has consistently dropped in quality of management, equipment, classes and pts since i moved to it a few years ago. the latest management seems inadequate frankly, creating a hostile environment and causing a number of the best pts to leave. i have to say that some of the pts left behind are as bad as the management. one pt, a certain female that this review won‚Äôt let me name, screams across the gym at people, sits on equipment and prevents others from using it, does tarot cards in the middle of the gym and is rude and obnoxious. another pt, toby blasts music so loud you can hear it wherever you are in the building, smashes bikes in his spin classes so hard that the ground below him shakes and a light fitting over a treadmill is almost ready to drop, and seems to spend much of his time ‚Äúon shift‚Äù actually just on his phone or on the massage beds. the management also has no concern for the standards within the gym - it stinks, the toilets are disgusting and the gym floor is always a mess. what‚Äôs more, there‚Äôs always groups of teenage boys hogging equipment and being generally loud and obnoxious. i really do not understand how puregym head office is letting this all happen. the talented staff are leaving, and the customers will follow. i‚Äôve cancelled my membership to this gym because it‚Äôs not a place i feel happy or comfortable being in anymore.

Review: i took out a membership this week at pure gym stratford and to say i was disgusted is an understatement. this past week i use the gym from around 4:30am till 6:30am and i can not believe the state of a 6 month old gym. firstly when entering you can see protien powder on the floor near the entrance which on the first day i assumed must be recent but the exact same patch was there on thursday 3 days later and hadnt looked like it was cleaned. multiple machines have out of order signs on them which is fine whilst the gym is empty but for multiple machines to be out of service for 4 days seems extremely uncaring. typical gyms or any public space tend to be their cleanest in the mornings as cleaning usually takes place at the end of shifts in most businesses but shockingly ive seen the same opened cans of redbud, spilled protein powder, electrolyte drink bottle and various other food wrapper and drink items left around the gym day after day. id like to assume that the staff are doing their best but to see the same rubbish for 4 days repeatedly is astounding. the weights have never been easy to find wether im looking for a specific dumbbell or plate which is inconvenient but i can blame users of the gym over the staff in this case but to see weights left in the same place between days seems strange considering this gym should be busy.  the biggest issue with this gym by far is the mens changing rooms. i can not explain the full extent of its filth. the horrible smell is actual putrid, the toilet cubicles have immense amounts of dirty toilet paper on the floor around them, there are stains on the floor and benches and what looks like hair and snot in the showers. i can not understand how there is not daily cleaning with a business of this kind. and there no sanitary stations like in other gyms. its a shame as the pure gym in stratford seems to be affordable considering the rapid growth of the local area but this gym either needs to increase its price to starve the less respecting customers and allow the rest to value the gym more as well as providing cleaning equipment so members can clean after themselves. and there needs to be some sort of cleaning schedule as i can not comprehend why its in such a state. i honestly would rather have a refund of the month and joining fee because this is genuinely shocking. i very much expect a bs corporate response but action needs to be taken immediately.

Review: started a class at wembley pure gym, bit chaotic initially as the trainer was late, i‚Äôm a 60 year old male with arthritis & scoliosis but still fit. i had previously done around 15 years of martial arts (30 years ago) both structured & unstructured but no matter where you train, in a boxing gym or a shack in thailand you always warm up & stretch else you can damage yourself. my arthritis in my shoulders is from the years of martial arts, my shattered right ankle still turns purple after i failed to warm up properly & wrecked it on a heavy bag. i assumed there was no warm up or stretch during the first class as the trainer was late & we were short of time but was oddly insistent on ‚Äúhard & fast‚Äù on the punch & kick pads. i‚Äôd warmed up a bit anyway as i was early for the class but it was worrying to see absolute beginners attempting to kick a pad with their shin in full roundhouse & bashing away with their fists on the pads with no initial stretching. no time was spent on warm up or technique & if you are going to attempt any martial arts structured or not technique is what you learn before anything else else you will damage yourself. the second class i was late, no trains to wembley at the moment & the bus got stuck but i thought i‚Äôm only 5mins late so went into the class. so after some initial pad work the trainer started giving me a hard time as i was not fast & hard enough on the kick pad, fair enough but given the class history of both not warming up before attempting this & my arthritis & scoliosis (i‚Äôd flagged this with him during my first class) i thought i was doing well not to injure myself further. the issue is the trainer was raising his voice to the point that he wanted everyone to hear & there was an obvious attempt to embarrass me & then he started saying by me not making an effort i was effecting the partner i was sharing the kick pad with, that‚Äôs fine i thought but i am also aware that if i go hard & fast i can with no warm up also damage myself as i know from history. seconds later there was another rant about my apparent lack of effort & then about my lateness & that the class starts at 6pm & when the door is shut or whatever you don‚Äôt come in but as i say i missed the induction last time as the trainer was around 10mins late so as he‚Äôs raising his voice & it becomes pretty obvious that‚Äôs he‚Äôs just attempting to embarrass again i wanted to remind him that last time i attended he was late but at the time i thought these things happen. i said yeah sorry i was late & i wasn‚Äôt aware of your rules but i wanted to say actually you are a hypocrite & you need to practise what you preach, you rolled late into the class last time & no point did you say sorry about that. at that point i thought it was just easier to leave the class & so i did. the one star review is for the class i attended which i felt frankly was a little dangerous with its corner cutting, the rest of the gym is fine, clean & well resourced with good classes

Review Title: Main gym was Bristol Abbey Wood
Review: main gym was bristol abbey wood, if you work normal hours forget about trying to fit in a work before or after work, the gym is so oversold and unusable during 7-10am and 5-10pm. my final session at the gym i was asked by 3 different people on a machine i just got on how many sets i had left, which showcases how busy we are talking. i addressed concerns to gym manager prior leaving whose only suggestion was work out during other hours - not a possibility for most.  froze my membership online, it then mentioned the ¬£6.99 to continue freezing, dont worry though puregym wont send you any emails or reminders about this and just charge you full price for multiple months instead when it finishes.  when you contact their support on twitter, the way you are meant to you will have some lacklustre response with no acknowledgment of previous loyalty or concerns about the gym that made you freeze it in the first place.  not sure what company in the modern world that doesnt send reminders but instead prays on you forgetting offering no refund despite not setting foot in the gym.  this was the last straw at considering keeping multiple gym contracts running to use pure when travelling but much better treatment at another gym and glad i have moved.

Review Title: Assistant Manager at London Wall Puregym Very RUDE!!
Review: i was at puregym (london wall site) on the morning of 9th aug 2023 and after 2hrs of working out i decided to cool down on the treadmill just doing a brisk walk.  one of the pg staff team who claim she is the manager, walked up to me and said i must put my bag away because it was health & safety. i said to her, i have been here for 2hrs now, so i am just cooling down for 10mins and i am done, before i knew what was happening i went back on the treadmill, the staff member said to me again, can you put your bag away now!  i again explained to her, i heard you, and i am aware of what you are asking, but i only need 10mins on the treadmill and i am done. she interrupted me again and was quite aggressive and insisting i put my bag away immediately!!! i got off the treadmill and said to her, my bag is not obstructing anyone and is practically nothing inside, the staff member got very defensive and said i was rude to her, i asked her, how am i being rude to you? she said i was frowning at her!!! next thing i knew what was happening she said something else (couldnt hear her due to the loud music) and then she stomped off.  i just want to make this clear i am aware of the no bags on gym floor policies, but i merely forgot to lock it away this morning and bought my bag on the gym floor. the staff member stated she is the manager, i am actually shocked to hear she is the manager and spoke to the members in that tone  i felt it was not what she said to me, but how she spoke to me, if she is the manager she should know very well as ‚Äúgood customer services‚Äù you don‚Äôt talk to your members like this, in fact you dont talk to anyone like this, i felt she spoke to me as if i was a stupid child in a playground! i am 51 years of age and i am aware of health & safety, i work for the nhs as a business manager so i appreciate she does not talk to the members as if they are some silly naughty child in a school classroom, does she speaks to her staff like that? she sounded like if i did not do it straight away as i am told, or i will get a slap!!!  what i am trying to said is, you will get members not always going to focus on the health & safety i.e. putting weights back or not to take bags or belongings onto gym floor, we all have busy life and not always aware of what we are doing, we just want to come to the gym do our training and leave. she could have just give me a little reminder and left it at that, and if i did this again, yes of course i agree there will be a warning, however don‚Äôt talk to me as if i am a stupid naughty child in a classroom, i did not appreciate it and i am sure no one want to be spoken to the way she did.  and for her to get defensive saying i was rude by frowning at her is just for her to attack me first, because she wanted the last words. i joined the whole of pgs (¬£54 a month) to use all the uk pg over a month ago so i can have the options to use other sites too, i do not pay this much to have some silly staff talk to me like i am stupid, frankly i felt harass and provoke by her, and pg is supposed to put a stop to harassment, this is a joke! puregym promote harrassment not preventing it"! puregym london wall deserve "0" star, i only use london wall site it 2 - 3 times a week because i work in the city! i go to other sites ( greenwich, kidbrooke, beckton etc and i never had any issues) this has left me feeling very vulnerable and quite anxious and at the same time i felt harass by her, but i am not going to allow this person make me feel harass or ruin my day.

Review Title: For the most part the gym is great
Review: for the most part the gym is great, plenty of machines and free weights, quiet if you avoid the obvious peak hours and the staff have always been helpful and pleasant on the occasions ive needed to speak to them.  the problem is the temperature, its been an issue every summer for years. its like an oven, im sweating before i even leave the changing room. after a workout i cant cool down enough even after showering for ages and i was on the verge of passing out doing cardio yesterday which has spurred me on to write this. its the same every year, plenty of people mention it to the staff and im sure they raise it up the chain but nothing ever seems to happen. last year they brought in free standing ac units which helped for a few months but this year, nothing.  please dont give the standard response of the smart monitors controlling the temperature. if there is then they are clearly broken, set far far to high or the air con units arent up to the job. its that bad when work colleagues have asked about joining ive put them off explaining the above. it really isnt good enough for the most expensive puregym in the country.

Review Title: Poor customer service at the London Finchley Branch
Review: i go regularly to puregym london finchley and i enjoy the classes very much.  unfortunately i work during the day (9am-5pm) and i really struggle to go to my pilates class in the mornings (i am on calls).  today i decided to pop into the new managers office and ask if it was possible to have pilates classes in the afternoon or evening at any point in the future.  the manager seemed to be offended by the suggestion and she took it personally. i apologized if i caused any stress and i ended up giving up because there was no way to reason with her.  before i left her office i explained that to my regret, i might need to change to another gym that has pilates classes when i finish work. i tried to help her to understand that i am spending too much money in extra classes at other places i thought that this information would calm her down but it made it worse.  to my surprise, when i left her office, she slammed the door behind me. unbelievable! i am still in shock.  i have been a puregym customer for many years but already cancelled my membership because i prefer to go to a more customer friendly gym.

Review: congested and no concern for safety! in reference to the london collindale location.  not even worth it for a budget gym. pay the little bit more and choose somewhere more decent. the ceiling is always leaking with the slightest bit of rain and they never seem to be concerned or fix it, instead they just place numerous buckets around in the already congested thoroughfare as the gym crams up with the unrestricted amount of members. the water that comes through is bad enough and a serious safety hazard without the bucket trip hazards and the actual smell of faeces that accompanies it. ive never seen it worse than on this occasion but there is so so often water dripping from ceiling. definitely a massive risk. and being 24 hours theyre just leaving themselves open to liability. do yourselves a favour and avoid at all costs.  edit: their generic response to this review only adds insult to injury and shows their complete lack of care when it comes to customer service.

Review Title: So much promise with such little delivery.
Review: the kit here is not bad at all, albeit skewed towards weights rather than cardio. in busy periods the (lack of) cardio kit can prove an achilles heel and having to wait for it can be frustrating. a little more thought towards the layout could actually fit more cross trainers / bikes in so this is something that would improve the place. free weights area is good. plenty of selection and kit. people are mostly tidy and put their kit back back, but as per other gyms this isn‚Äôt always the case. there are however some fairly big issues, hence the two stars. all of which could be easily resolved but the on site staff/ puregym as a company seem reluctant to do.  * male changing rooms. these are consistently dirty, even after the cleaners have just cleaned (if you ever witness the cleaners doing their job you‚Äôll see why - very poor). the showers are also a bone of contention, and with only three to begin with the fact that they are now down to one shower for an entire male changing room in a busy gym is unacceptable. one of the out of order showers has had a broken door for 7 weeks, again unacceptable. inside of the lockers is consistently dirty too and many lockers have the locks left on all week, again not enforced by the staff.  * the rules are not enforced. there are multiple printed out sheets telling you of them , (they love a laminated document and some blu tac here), but little enforcement. groups of young males training vocally, not putting their kit back and half clothed doesn‚Äôt create an inviting environment for all, as puregym say they do, and these rules are not enforced. multiple laminated sheets printed out telling people they will be banned for training semi- clothed and not putting their kit back = nothing actually happens.  *maintenance times. when kit breaks here it takes weeks/ months to fix. appreciate it‚Äôs a big company and bangor is out in the sticks so to speak, but this is still pretty shoddy. leg extender machine has had a nice laminated notice on it to not push beyond point 8 for 2 months, but not actually been fixed, shower door as above, cross trainer took 6 weeks + to fix‚Ä¶. when something breaks here there appears to be no sense of urgency from the on site staff particularly or puregym as a company. the urinal in the male changing room was full of urine for a month not long ago before it was fixed.  * water. the water as a whole here is an issue and they 100% have an on site issue , i‚Äôm a plumber and know what i‚Äôm looking for. the water fountain pressure is up and down and barely a dribble, shower pressure ,( when they work), is also barely a dribble and the male urinals flush 24/7, they never stop. this has nothing to do with saving water with regards to the low pressure, this is an on site issue. again going on for months, again not sorted.  the air con. the pace is stuffy and need good, reliable air circulation. it doesn‚Äôt have that, and as a consequence the place is warmer than a gym should be, and the plethora of gym members here who don‚Äôt smell every nice make the warm, sticky environment that little bit worse. the place has a smell to it which isn‚Äôt pleasant a lot of the time.   puregym really need to get their act together here, or all they‚Äôll end up with having as members are the students who want a cheap gym membership, and mostly these are the same students who don‚Äôt put their weights back/throw their litter away/train half clothed - think on that one for a second.  they also need to employ a management team on site who is more proactive and gets stuff done. the gym and site has gone massively down hill over the last three months and continues to go more down the more time goes on, which will only get worse. the management team in place at the beginning of the year was more prone to challenging members and keeping on top of kit repairs, rather than laminating a sheet saying they‚Äôre doing it and then not actually getting it done. no offence to the current team as they‚Äôre lovely people, but they‚Äôre meek and reserved and don‚Äôt follow up on their promises to get issues sorted. ‚Äòwe‚Äôve reported it‚Äô and ‚Äòwe‚Äôre waiting for an engineer‚Äô only holds so much water. report more, chase more, until it‚Äôs done. that‚Äôs customer service, that‚Äôs customer satisfaction and that is what this site is missing, which is a shame. the lack of experience from management here can be summarised by an instagram posts from the manager a few weeks ago. it was 20 odd degrees outside, so warm, and their water went off. no toilets/water fountain/showers or taps. but the manager put an instagram post up saying people can still come to the gym. you just can‚Äôt drink, pee or shower. the mind boggles.  a more customer focussed, business savvy manager, better enforcement of the rules and and more urgency regarding the repairs and that would sort this place, but at the moment it‚Äôs a mess.  que the pg copy and paste reply :)

Review Title: My experience with the gym's personal‚Ä¶
Review: my experience with the gyms personal trainer was nothing short of disappointing and uncomfortable. my friends(totally beginners) and i were in the middle of our workout, doing a superset, when the trainer approached us. he inquired about the number of sets remaining with the dumbbells. we informed him that we still had a considerable number of sets left to complete. he then suggested using heavier dumbbells, but unfortunately, there were no other suitable options available. he mockingly suggested that we should try using lighter weights upstairs. this condescending and belittling remark left us feeling humiliated and judged.  its disheartening to encounter such unprofessional behavior from a personal trainer who should be motivating and inspiring clients to push themselves, not ridiculing them for their chosen weights. making us feel inadequate and uncomfortable in the gym environment is completely unacceptable.  to make matters worse, he and his client continued to talk and stare at us, adding to the sense of being the center of unwanted attention. it was as if he was more interested in gossiping about us than actually focusing on his own clients workout.  this kind of behavior reflects poorly on the gym and its staff. as paying members, we should be treated with respect and encouragement, not subjected to mockery and discomfort. i sincerely hope the gym takes this feedback seriously and addresses the issue promptly to ensure a more supportive and inclusive environment for all its members.  despite the unfortunate encounter with the rude gym staff, i must acknowledge that the gym itself offers a comprehensive range of equipment and facilities. however, it is imperative for the management to address and rectify such instances of unprofessional behavior to maintain a positive and inclusive environment for all members. i sincerely hope that my feedback will contribute to the improvement of overall customer satisfaction and service quality at the gym.

Review: i first joined puregym longbridge back in 2021 when covid was still around, the gym was always clean, not too busy and staff were always around, very helpful whenever you need them unfortunately the gym went downhill when covid restrictions lifted, the staff are much less engaged, the gym is busy most of the time, and it‚Äôs not that clean anymore! i cancelled my membership after few bad experiences (not being able to get the equipment i wanted or waiting around for it to be free, and not finding much space to do anything in the functional area) i have recently paid for a day pass to try their yoga class  just to go and find out that the staff didn‚Äôt even know there was a yoga class happening or who the instructor was, after waiting for around 10 minutes we were told that the instructor is not coming! which was just ridiculous! i‚Äôve never experienced something like this in any gym before!!  i knew that cancelling my membership was the right decision, i would rather pay for something that i get something good out of it, but puregym is just a waste of both time and money

Review Title: You couldn't pay me to train here
Review: extremely hot, extremely busy and extremely annoying.  i will preface this by saying that i only have positive experiences with the staff there. nothing against them. i would give the staff 5 stars. cameron, in particular, is an asset to the gym.  the place is like a cambodian jungle with the heat and humidity.  the brand new barbells and dumbbells have little to no knurling on them. quite dangerous, actually, when performing bench press and associated lifts in which a slip would be very bad news.  the gym gets so busy. not just a little busier at peak hours, it is unusable at peak hours. ~100 people in there officially. not to mention those unaccounted for, who enter the gym without a membership at the same time as their friends.  ive never been on a morning but on a weeknight, during the hours of 16:00-21:00, the gym is unusable. forget following an exercise routine. theres no chance.  equipment selection and utilisation of floor space is extremely poor. one flat bench press to serve the entire gym. not enough weight benches to serve the free weights section. flat bench and decline bench pushed right up against each other, preventing spotters from easily accessing them.  truthfully, they need a bigger facility, but more importantly than this is that they utilise the space that they do have effectively. the space upstairs is extremely poorly utilised. additionally, they should look to expand the entire upstairs and make it as large as the lower floor.  dont waste your time joining this gym. i have been attending gyms regularly for almost one decade now. never have i ever been so inconsistent with my routines. the gym does not permit it. i was a member for one month and have cancelled my membership. there have been many occasions where i turn up to the gym, only to walk straight out of the door.  puregym consett is a victim of its own success. it is supposed to be a budget gym, but with the cheapest membership at ¬£22, the price certainly does not make up for the inconvenience. you couldnt pay me to use this gym.
Generated Topics:
1. the gym is extremely hot.
2. the gym is extremely busy.
3. the equipment is poor.
Extracted Topics: the gym is extremely hot. | the gym is extremely busy. | the equipment is poor.

Review Title: Extremely expensive prices that I can't‚Ä¶
Review: extremely expensive prices that i cant afford, you have to pay for plus which is ¬£36 a month just to be able to use the yanga water drink machine which isnt ven in some puregyms. the core prices arent any better at ¬£30 but you get less benefits than plus. the off-peak option is ¬£22. which is a standard high price at other gyms. but puregym gives us much less benefits with that option so we dont get to go gym what times we want and have to fit their timetable which isnt clear anyway. when puregym has discounts or deals, they only do it for a select few gyms. also the prices change on the location instead of puregym having standard prices across board. if i wanted to downgrade there isnt benefits to that and if i wanted to cancel as you can only freeze so many times and they charge you if you do it close to the date. i will have to pay another ¬£20 joining fee, so no loyalty to customers.

Review Title: Zero Joining Fee, More Like Zero Respect. 10 Years of Loyalty = Absolutely Nothing.
Review: i was a member of puregym for almost 10 years and happily so. i even upgraded to the premium membership as well last year and hired a pt and i feel like i can confidently say that i am a gym rat as i go very frequently. i have had friends and family tell me many times about various deals at other gyms that would offer me more value for money and better prices for different pts with proven results over the months and years, but out of good will i decided to stay loyal to puregym. to the point that i managed to convince various friends of mine to come over also this past year after years of workouts. this past month however, i feel like i have been let down drastically and my loyalty has all been for nothing. in the whole time i have been a member at your gym, i have stuck to my payments and been on time without asking for any kind of favour or making any kind of complaint. 2 weeks ago, i made it known that i would struggle for the first time due to the recent cost of living, and that my payment was going to be delayed by only a few hours, if that until my pay check came through and i tried to ask what could be done to make sure i wasnt either charged extra or penalised for this. so you can imagine my disappointment when i was bluntly told that there would be no help granted in regards to this situation without any attempt at a solution. so i had no choice but to cancel my membership to make sure i could get through last month without incurring any extra charges. since then i have found another gym which i am now signed up to, so i assumed that would be the end of this saga that i have been through these past few weeks. apparently this is not the case as i still have to pay one last month to my pt despite being at a completely different gym! i dont care about being compensated for any funds if anybody should finally deem it necessary. its been made perfectly clear to me in the recent days that my financial situation isnt being taken seriously by puregym and that neither are your customers if this is how a long time and loyal member of your gym can be treated. i 100% will not be going back once this is over and i hope nobody else has to go through this disappointment and betrayal of trust and loyalty either.
Generated Topics:

Review Title: Poor Gym not PureGym in Great Portland St.
Review: this puregym in great portland st (it is actually in cavendish mews) is unbearable during the summer month due their aircon not being able cope with the heat.  my husband and have been members for about 6 years and during this time, puregym has suffered from the same issues with the aircon and tv‚Äôs not working. the tv problems has been ongoing for about 3 years and the same excuse ‚Äúwe are waiting for parts to fix it‚Äù.  it is a basement gym, and as you enter it, the warmth and a strange decomposing smell greets you, most probably due to the lack of air circulation. it is not pleasant. the various lovely gym managers over the years have had the same problems with head office not caring about fixing the aircon and tv‚Äôs. it appears that the puregym head office is not interested in investing in this gym so that everything works as it should and member get what they have paid for through their membership.  all the staff are super friendly and it is a clean gym however the non-working aircon and tv‚Äôs makes a very poor gym.  i cannot recommend joining puregym during the summer months unless you like it very warm. the gym is fine during winter.

Review Title: Had to upgrade package just to breathe better in the gym
Review: i recently reactivated my membership with the off-peak package at pure gym enfield, enticed by its affordable price of ¬£22. however, my experience has been far from satisfactory.  the main issue with the off-peak package is that it restricts users to access the gym only after 21:00. this limitation has resulted in overcrowding during the available hours, making it incredibly challenging to find any space, machines, or free weights to use. it defeats the purpose of a gym membership if you cannot utilise the facilities due to excessive demand.  pure gym enfield offers a solution to this problem by providing an upgrade option for an additional ¬£7, allowing subscribers to access the facilities at any time. however, this feels like an unnecessary expense to overcome the gyms own overcrowding issue.  furthermore, i found the standards at the gym to be disappointing. the ventilation system appears to be inadequate, especially when the air conditioning is not in operation. poor ventilation poses a potential health and safety risk, particularly during intense workout sessions when fresh airflow is crucial.  overall, my experience at pure gym enfield has been unsatisfactory. the overcrowding issue during off-peak hours, coupled with the need to pay extra for a better workout experience, has left me disappointed. the subpar ventilation system further exacerbates the problems and raises concerns about the gyms commitment to its members well-being.  i hope that pure gym enfield takes these issues into consideration and makes the necessary improvements to provide a better experience for its members.

Review Title: Not the cleanest of gyms I‚Äôm afraid
Review: so i was recently asked by pure gym to be submit my feedback following a recent visit. i highlighted the lack of cleaning stations and cleaning products in the gym . stephen , responded with the usual blah blah, so i asked stephen ( deputy manager ) if pure gym values its members health, and that bacteria, germs and goodness what are still rife .. sadly no response. i asked stephen to explain why there are no cleaning stations in the ladies gym , his response .. ‚Äòthey can be found in the main part of the gym‚Äô. which is a male dominated area! i highlighted this too and no response. so stephen speaking on behalf of a large conglomerate as pure gym has decided that paying women members who choose to remain in the ladies area do not warrant a hygiene station. - comment to stephen  please explain why there is no cleaning station available in the ladies gym? why are you ok for bacteria , germs, sweat etc to be passed from person to machine to person again?  most gyms would have signs to say wipe down after use?   and stephen‚Äôs response:  there is a cleaning station on the main floor which everyone can use. everything can be found in the terms and conditions when people sign up regarding wiping down !  unbelievable completely ignoring the seriousness of the issue.  thanks for your response, but you cannot have visited the park royal gym recently. as you said during the pandemic time your hygiene standards were exemplary, but now they are substandard and your members health and wellbeing is not important!! it‚Äôs a cost saving exercise and wish you‚Äôd just admit this. sadly, your response says a lot and i‚Äôm afraid you will lose another member. i‚Äôd be interested to see this government guidelines you mentioned as i‚Äôm unable to locate it on gov.uk .  sadly park royal , is no where near the hygiene levels mentioned by others.. this is what is supposed todo according to sports and england dept  ensure clean surfaces and equipment  you must make sure that any equipment provided as part of your activity is cleaned frequently with the appropriate products, such as disinfectant wipes.  shared equipment provided by the venue or organisation must periodically be washed thoroughly.

pure gym‚Äôs lack of response and action is concerning.

Review: i‚Äôve been a member for over five years and have been pretty happy with the worcester branch until this year. my issue is with the air quality and temperature. some days, it‚Äôs like walking into a sauna. it‚Äôs often humid, smells sweaty and is too warm to be able to train effectively. this isn‚Äôt usually on very hot days. yesterday (30/06/23) was so bad, i didn‚Äôt train and left after speaking to the manager. i have asthma and started to feel breathless after just a few minutes inside the gym. (my asthma is well-regulated and i always check my sp02 before and after entering the gym.) my peak flow was fine but the stuffy air made me feel faint quite quickly.) i‚Äôve spoken to the manager on various occasions about the inconsistency of the gym‚Äôs air quality and temperature, and he has told me that the air-con is set to a minimum of 20 degrees. this is warm for a gym and especially uncomfortable for high intensity cardio exercise. he told me that he can‚Äôt change the temperature. pure gym has stated on twitter that individual gym managers control their gym‚Äôs temperature and ventilation system; there is no company policy that dictates it. according to conor the manager, this is the temperature that keeps the bills down and most people don‚Äôt complain because they don‚Äôt do cardio. he can‚Äôt change it because he won‚Äôt change it, is his explanation in a nutshell. i‚Äôm a pt (and also exercise referral qualified) so am well aware of the impact on physical performance as temperature progresses. for people who want to run, row, cycle etc, it‚Äôs really uncomfortable and can cause faintness, with the potential for injury. i‚Äôm pretty close to cancelling my membership at this point, having tried unsuccessfully to deal with this directly.  update gym temperature 04/07/23: 22 degrees

Review Title: PureGym, you're letting your members down
Review: reviewing for puregym as a whole, being a member that attends tottenham court road and marylebone. im fed up of the class changes, which have massively affected my fitness journey. marylebone started charging ¬£4 for a particular step class, which plummeted overnight in attendees and eventually got cancelled. now the same is being applied to tottenham court road. as a result im looking elsewhere as the brand lacks care for quality and care for its members that seek a fitness routine thats guided by an instructor in the comfort of a class.  puregym instructor led classes lack enthusiasm and inspiration. most will lead a class without any involvement or even breaking a sweat; how inspiring!  in contrast, after trial and error across 3 puregym locations (swiss cottage, marylebone, tottenham court) private instructor lead classes (specifically aerobics/ step/ pilates) have instructors that give 110% effort every class.  its a shame to have already seen a favoured and fully booked class at marylebone go down the drain, to see another favoured class at tottenham court do the same. im fed up and currently trialling other gym brands, puregym youve let me and a lot of your members down.

Review: where do i start‚Ä¶. i have been a member of this gym for  a number of years now and i have seen a huge decline with how the gym is run and managed. the gym facilities, air conditioning, equipment and parking  has hit it‚Äôs all time lowest point and it appears to me that  this gym is being run into the ground. the only good thing about the gym is the space to train but there are now so many problems which have not been fixed or dealt with over the years that the issues can not be overlooked anymore.  when speaking to management about the issues it‚Äôs never ending excuses with issues not being fixed or dealt with properly.  it‚Äôs only going to get worse which is completely unacceptable with the amount of money they are making from memberships each month. despite the issues and members complaints they actually had the audacity to increase the gym membership 4 months to ago to help ‚Äútowards the gym maintenance‚Äù, no improvements have been made in this time and it‚Äôs got significantly worse. below is a small snapshot of the issues  .. ‚Ä¢the air conditioning in the gym has again stopped working as soon as the hot weather arrives, this is the third year in a row this has happened. the mangers that have come and gone in this time all make the same excuses and say they are working on it and air conditioning unit uses a smart system which isnt so smart! its unbearable to train with the heat, not pleasant breathing in everyone‚Äôs germs and body odours, sweating like your in a sauna and generally not a nice environment to be in. i felt like i was going to pass out the other day, at least last year they left all the doors open and they hired large portable aircon units. i‚Äôve had to start training at other gyms because of  this which i shouldn‚Äôt have to do when i‚Äôm paying for this membership. ‚Ä¢ the gym equipment is now old and tired and needs replacing ( like the new precor equipment they have down south) things are always broken with out of order signs on, most of  the cable machines are tired  and on there way out, dumbbells and olympic bars are mostly bent, some cardio machines are broken and need serious maintenance. a serious injury will occur, it‚Äôs just waiting to happen! ‚Ä¢cleaning facilities to wipe equipment down has been reduced  since january therefore equipment is not as clean as it should be. it might be the time of day i train but i personally have never seen a member of staff cleaning the equipment and also changing rooms have a disgusting smell constantly.‚Ä¢the gym did not notify members that 3 months ago there would be building work commencing in the apartments across the road and that the building company would be using upto 20 car park spaces and their builders allowed to park in it too. parking is difficult for members best of times and not enough spaces for the gym capacity before this. parking is at a premium and you cannot park in any of the surrounding streets as they are all double yellow lines. we don‚Äôt know when it will finish. on many occasions i and other members have had to train at other gyms when it is busy after 5pm because we can‚Äôt find a parking space. ‚Ä¢most  of the pt‚Äôs are  unfriendly and not welcoming unless you‚Äôre part of their ‚Äúclique‚Äù‚Ä¢the new assistant manager needs to address the issues raised by not only myself, but many other members too instead of parading around the gym gawping at myself and other male members.  i find it really uncomfortable and actually hypocritical given they promote ‚Äúa no harassment‚Äù  campaign on posters all over the gym. check the cctv, you can clearly see him checking individuals out. ‚Ä¢the gym is listed on a gay dating/meet up site which members can use the facilities late at night to get up to alsorts. its been highly rated aswell believe it or not.. madness! it‚Äôs not what we signed up to. the list is endless and no matter which manager takes over or managers from head office, none appear to be doing anything about it.unless something changes drastically, which i don‚Äôt think it will, there will be a mass exodus where members will leave and not come back. you shouldn‚Äôt be charged nearly ¬£30 a month to be train in substandard facilities where management don‚Äôt listen to or address any issues raised. if you are thinking of joining this gym, do yourself a favour and find another one.

Review Title: Please get a grip on your staff!!!
Review: i canceled my gym membership after a few months due to various reasons, primarily because of a staff member (edit: management at pure gym reported my review for identifying the staff member by name so i have omitted it from the review. however she has been mentioned in other reviews here and on google). she acts like she owns the gym, regularly forcing members, including myself, out of the weights section for her private class. she also records these classes for her social media which picks up other members in the background who probably don‚Äôt want to be in the video (i know i certainly don‚Äôt want to be an extra in the background of her boxercise vids). despite the availability of a private room, she insists on disrupting our workouts.  this is not the first time ive witnessed her rude behavior. when a member asked for help with a malfunctioning machine, she responded with a sour face as if she was being inconvenienced even though its her literal job.  additionally, she frequently shouts and uses foul language. other reviews also mention similar experiences with her. while the rest of the staff is friendly and the renovated womens section is great, the gym is often overcrowded, and my overall experience is consistently ruined by this staff member. considering the price increase and my dissatisfaction, i have decided to switch to thegym despite the longer journey.  edit: i‚Äôm not entirely sure why pure gym management have asked me to update my review. unless they have addressed the issue of the member who created a hostile environment, there is no reason for me to make any changes. simply stating that theres no tolerance for that behaviour make no difference to me or other members at the gymü•¥

Review: i just started this week. had zumba, bodyfit and dance so far. zumba was fine (ok types, i have done more active zumba at another gym in west hampstead). bodyfit was also ok but dance was just weird. first 15 mins we did 2 songs in good active dance movements and just as i was beginning to sweat and burn fat, the instructor started showing us some moves on the mat (like pilates or yoga) and she spent so much time trying to explain us the moves that my body completely cooled down. the rest of the 30 mins was just her showing us steps, we trying to learn and then doing it. but im sure i didnt burn a single calorie. it would be good to have a dance class which claims to burn over 250 cals do just that and not bother with teaching us some spiderman moves! also the smell of sweat is way too overpowering and general cleanliness is clearly lacking, but so many people have said the same thing in the reviews and if nothing has happened so far, maybe itll stay this way. my goal is to lose weight and gain some core strength so i will be continuing but not as happily as my experience with studio society at west hampstead.

Review: puregym‚Äôs class cancellation policy (cancel up to 4 hours before the class starts, 3 late cancellations within a month and you lose the right to book classes) is ableist and inaccessible. ironic as marketing is always putting out ‚Äòbe your authentic self‚Äô and ‚Äòour gyms are for everyone‚Äô messages.  some disabilities, parental and carer responsibilities, mental health conditions - and just if you had booked an early morning class and woke up feeling ill - are all reasons why the 4 hour window is too large and disproportionately affects groups that already face challenges.  speaking from a place of lived experience, i don‚Äôt think puregym is as inclusive as it brands itself as and i‚Äôd encourage it to look at its cancellation policy with someone who can advise on diversity, inclusion and equity.  puregym: you‚Äôre alienating a very large proportion of your customers and it adds insult to injury that your marketing messages don‚Äôt align. do better.

Review Title: Some major issues need to be addressed
Review: the gym is totally fine when not too busy (e.g. weekend afternoons or late mornings), but due to its proximity to schools/college, its often flooded with groups of teenagers who dont respect basic rules like putting the weights back or cleaning equipment after their use. the lack of hygiene of these young gym goers is something that should be addressed by the staff as well. also, they tend to be glued to certain machines without actually doing anything (they are just chatting, laughing and playing games on their phones). the worst issue however is that many of them are underage (some look 11-12) which is against the gyms own rules (please see membership t&cs) and they clearly shouldnt be in this space. the workers dont seem to be bothered with this issue, but this is a serious safeguarding problem and may also invalidate the business insurance in case any injury is caused to (or by) these kids. i hope this feedback is taken seriously and some real actions will be taken to observe the gyms own rules by its workers and prevent underage kids from joining/attending the gym.

Review Title: Disgusting male showers. I can't believe nobody has complained about this yet.
Review: this is a message i tried to send privately -via email, private message on social media, etc. but you dont make it easy: no contact emails, phones and use chatbots on social media. i had no luck getting to a real person so ill copy it all here.  hi, i have been wanting to write for a few weeks now regarding the state of the male showers in some of your gyms. i have been a member for over a decade and used to visit one or more of your gyms in edinburgh almost daily. to me these were exceptional, well priced and always clean.  well, after a long break during the pandemic years i have started training again -mostly in edinburgh west gym but also in the one in dunfermline, and have to say the state of the shower facilities is really something... i have thought many times about taking some photos or a video and posting it all to social media but i dont like to be the creep with a phone out in the changing rooms and prefer to give you the chance to rectify this.  just to make it clear, the male showers in edinburgh west are not being properly (or at all?) cleaned -they have orange stains (accumulated dirt) all over the place, shower drains that were partially blocked by fluff and stuff weeks ago still as they were. this is the case no matter what time (early morning, afternoon, late at night) i visit. every single time i find myself looking for a shower that would not instantly give me some kind of fungal bacteria by merely stepping onto it. yesterday it was mission impossible... honestly, most disgusting showers i have ever encounter! its not dirt of use, its dirt of not being cleaned.  this was my experience too a few months back in the dunfermline but admittedly i havent had to use them as much so cannot confirm if still the case -going there today, so ill update later.  the changing rooms and the gym floors are nice and clean, this message is only about the state of the showers.  i always recommended puregym to everybody: great gym network, good atmosphere, excellent pricing and, at the time, superb cleaning. what happened in the last few years?  i cannot be the first writing about this but regardless, i would really appreciate if you forward this message to someone who can act on it asap.  thanks.
Generated Topics:
on it.

2. no contact
3. edinburgh west gyms To answer this question, I

Review: after joining puregym stratford when it opened, in january, my partner and i lasted less than four months at this establishment.  this is the most unhygienic gym we have visited; no wipe down stations, no paper towels, and embarrassing standards means equipment is greasy if not wet and wiping your hands on your own towel will literally leave marks after using any equipment.  the male changing rooms constantly smell like urine, and when gents enter the odour wafts out into the main floor. every time.  the management is incompetent. my partner and i eventually left after being physically threatened infront of a member of staff, who was less than enthused about dealing with the situation. after constant pressure to the ‚Äòsafe space‚Äô team, he then turned around his story and started blaming us. apparently, gyms are full of testosterone and hormones, and so it‚Äôs perfectly natural that people threaten to wait outside the premises to harm you. tattooed manager, please get a new line of work.  a separate but related note: i was initially amused by the inclusion of a ‚Äòsharps bin‚Äô in the gents toilets. on reflection, i‚Äôm sure this is a bennie that the crack and/or meat heads really appreciate.  i cannot stress enough: avoid this gym. absolute embarrassment of an establishment.
