Review Title: Why does the website tell you to ring a number that just tells you to go to website???? I‚Äôve been trying to book an induction‚Ä¶
Review: i‚Äôve been trying to book an induction for nearly 2 months. i‚Äôve had email‚Äôs ignored, emails that sent me to the website, website said to ring a number to book induction, this has answering message saying they are an online gym there is no telephone service - so why put it on the website and emails???? Review Title: A sheep dip would be cleaner than your showers ü§Æ‚ò†Ô∏èüò©
Review: ive been a member of this gym for about 2 years and ive noticed that the hygiene and cleanliness standards for the mens changing room have deteriorated somewhat, particularly the showers that have a dreadful stench to them. i think maybe the drains need clearing or changing.  if you scroll down at other reviews of this gym, there is a consistent complaint about the poor standards in the changing room, toiles and showers. the other thing that is pretty consistent is the robotic standard response saying that they take it into account yet changed nothing for over half a year.  it regularly stinks of weed in the changing rooms and in the stairwell.  furthermore ive noticed that theres a lot of chopping and changing of classes, primarily due to the high churn of pt staff. it makes it more difficult to get into and stick to a regular fitness routine with pts and classes you enjoy when the schedule is constantly changing. i think in the time ive been a member of this gym i need both hands to count the changes in management.  i like this gym, i like the team, although i know only a few of them now. i want it to do well, but i also think puregym hq needs to invest some time and money in helping them bring it back up to standard

Review Title: I‚Äôm really disappointed in the fact‚Ä¶
Review: i‚Äôm really disappointed in the fact that if you are doing a workout and in the middle of a session you can be asked to remove yourself from a machine if a class is starting and the people in that class need it.  its not the staffs fault i know but i pay my membership the same as others and should be able to complete my session..surely if you are in the middle of a workout you should be able to finish?  today at my local (galashiels branch) i was trying to beat my best performance on the rowing machine when i was interrupted.. the instructor asked me to finish up what i was doing and to give priority to the class..  i mean the instructor he was polite enough but being politely asked to stop your workout isn‚Äôt going to get me back to fitness.  this has happened to me twice now, once before work at 6am when i was trying to get a session in on the rower and now after work.  coming back from a running injury it‚Äôs my go to machine to workout on ..tonight after being asked to finish up on the rower again half way through my session and with almost all other machines busy, i was forced to change my session and end it early.  this needs sorted out, either by adding more rowers or having an alternative exercise for the class when someone is using the a machine?  come on puregym, this is a poor show

Review: i used a three day free trial at this gym to try it out as i wanted to join a gym. the first thing i noticed was that i could only go to the specific gym i had the pass for. i only noticed this once trying to gain access to the putney gym... but the code to enter didnt work. this wasnt a great start. the problem with these gyms being unstaffed is that you cant actually speak to anyone to resolve the issue and gain entry. you cant even phone them as they dont have a phone number. all you can do is email them and wait several hours for an answer, but why would you waste several hours waiting outside a gym for an answer to an email? very impractical  i then walked to the gym in wandsworth town which is the gym i had initially selected and fortunately gained access. i tried this gym out for three days and it also seemed like it was usually unstaffed. i at least managed to gain access and was able to exit the gym without much ado. although, needing a code to gain entrance and the gym being unstaffed didnt fill me with much confidence if the emergency services would need to gain immediate access due to needing a code to get in. if they did manage to get in by some quirk of fate, and needed to stretcher someone out then theres no way in a thousand years theyd be able to carry anyone out on a stretcher through those pods - even if they had a code.  i know they have their emergency leaver in case of an emergency, but they would still struggle to get in even if the emergency button worked properly.  from reading other reviews it seems like the emergency button has been used before and there was no help available.  for these reasons i would not recommend using this gym, even if it is somewhat cheaper than the competitors. the lower price comes at a higher risk!
Generated Topics:
1. i could only go to the specific gym i had the pass for.
2. the gym i had initially selected was wandsworth
Extracted Topics: i could only go to the specific gym i had the pass for. | the gym i had initially selected was wandsworth

Review: one star ‚≠ê for the friendliness and professionalism of most of the staff. one star ‚≠ê for the classes i attend because those instructors are just brilliant. no star for the cleanliness of the entire gym, including changing rooms, toilets and showers. the only time the changing rooms are clean is around 10-11am on week days as i can see a cleaner working. no star for lacking the disinfectants and paper towels for wiping an equipment after workout. no star for the ac in the changing rooms not working as a heater during cold months or cold days. no star for resetting a shower temperature to cool (summer-warm) and reducing the time of running water to half of the time (approx.7sec before it turns itself off) since the british summer time in march despite there was no sign of warmer weather. i was told by the managers that they couldnt do anything about it as it is a puregym scheme trial in all gyms and that i can contact the company myself, but with no specific contact details provided. to me it looks more like saving on energy bills for obvious to all of us reasons! (im sure this shower temperature changes are not listed in the "terms and conditions"). i joined the gym shortly after it was newly open but if there will be no changes to my "no star" reasons in near future, i will reconsider to join somewhere else where i feel comfortable, cold free and my money is well spent for. what is the point to get fitter when my health is jeopardised by catching a frequent cold from using no warm showers, being surrounded by dust mites or catching germs from an undisinfected equipment. well, what wont kill you, will make you stronger would not quite apply here.

Review Title: Absolute joke - fraudsters who keep taking money
Review: absolute joke! i cancelled my membership in march, only to check my bank account this month and realize that payment had still been taken out twice in april and may. went back to my app profile to find membership still active and cancellation option blanked out. looked for contact details for a direct phone conversation - theres none. went through twitter in the end just to be connected with a bot that told me it couldnt follow my request and that a member of staff would get in touch. this actually did happen, but the outcome was an absolute joke as i was told that it was basically my fault/ my banks fault that the direct debit had not been cancelled. a refund would not be issued. dont join this gym, and especially do not trust their own cancellation policy/ app. just cut payments off with your bank. i will report them for sure.

Review Title: really good gym, poor customer service
Review: the gym itself was really good and had everything you could possibly need. however, the customer service and staff were of no help. when in the gym toilets i had a member of staff talk very rudely towards me over getting mud all over the floor when it was not in fact me and i had clean shoes on. furthermore, when i contacted customer service due to breaking a bone and the website not letting me cancel my subscription, i had a response of ‚Äútry the website‚Äù which was obviously very unhelpful. after sending 3 different emails on different consecutive days i finally got a reply along the lines of ‚Äúplease don‚Äôt email lots of different times, instead email in a chain‚Äù not sure why they couldn‚Äôt of just sent a helpful email instead of wasting time sending an email on how i shouldn‚Äôt email. anyways, customer service never helped me resolve this issue and i had to contact my bank instead who sorted the issue immediately.

Review: this gym is 4 floors underground. i took advantage of the 3 day pass in january, (unfortunately they are not 24 hours so when i signed up just before midnight id already lost a day) i then signed up for another month cancelling after this as i found the atmosphere very weird and a number of staff seemed to be obsessed with my activities and whereabouts. i couldnt use my pin at the front entrance, which i think was done on purpose so i could give the staff something to do. it too weeks to rectify this, the tanoy system was sometimes put on very loud, which was quite offputting if you were "getting in the zone" music was controlled by staff seemingly so either on the treadmill or the mat. it is a very big gym, and with the membership price being the lowest on the market you really have to push through (being of a shyier nature) just to get past (some of)the staff. generally other gym goers are very respectful, keep themselves to themselves and the gym is big enough for there always to be a space for what you want to do, but i get the impression staff have to like you for you to be allowed to do what you want to do.  i then restarted my membership, for half the price, and no joining fee, and then paid for another month. for the last week i have been purchasing day passes until friday there was a leak and so it was a bit of a waste of money as the gym was closed because a massive section of the floor was completely flooded of sewage water into the female changing room and a section by the running machines. why this wasnt closed prior to 6pm or shortly after when id arrived i do not know - clearly it had not just started. i recieved an email at 10pm - 3 and a half hours after purchasing my day pass, 2 hours after being thrown out the gym, that it would work at other pure gyms unfortunately by 3pm the next day this feature was taken off.  the cleaner i met when i first joined was quite bolshy in the changing room, she was later hovering by the running machines, there are probably a few, generally the changing room toilets were always very dirty, i often saw toilet rolls were just left on the floor - whether you are a personal trainer of a cleaner, - i dont think they are cleaned regularly, but if you are working for an establishment at least take some pride in the facillities which are a)paying your wages b)being used by paying clients showers are clean but this is more from them not being used than anything else lots of the lockers in the female changing room are either broken, nearly broken or used without a lock, so when you are rushing and trying to find a space to put your stuff - good luck! i went into the mens on friday after arriving and the females being pretty much out of order, and they are far cleaner, bigger and of a general better condition. it is student led and i think the staff are comfortable with this. being from a dancing/fitness/performing back ground i really have to work hard in the gym and i also like to keep myself to myself i have found the staffs obsession with what i am doing both off putting and upsetting. there are 4 gyms in liverpool (puregyms) but as this is right in the centre by both liverpool lime street and central it is very easy to get to. i also kept initially getting my timings wrong, and instead of a member of staff just saying oh off peak is from 1.30, (i went at 1 one day) i really had to go into the app / website - the pods are tiny, its a struggle to fit in if you have a rucksack on your back, also if you are a bit claustrophobic but after being rejected access through the main door i got used to these pods- when my code actually worked. i think some staff have to remember they work for puregym, (and not the other way around) - unprofessional, uncooperative and lazy pts

dont know, but it seems like the staff are more obsessed with their own activities than the wellbeing of the members.

Review Title: Once you get in the gym and start using‚Ä¶
Review: once you get in the gym and start using the equipment, your frustration levels are easily settled (maybe due to physical exercises) and you can acknowledge that this gym (pure gym london borough) is a decent average gym. actually getting there (and literally into the gym) is a challenging but rather annoying hurdle one must overcome. this gym is often unstaffed, that means: no one at reception, no one answering your phone calls or messages. you cannot get basic information from the generic website. the lack of staff can make this an affordably cheap gym, but perhaps human support would be worth the extra penny. and bring a bloody lock for your locker as there is absolutely no information about this on their site. all in all, after my initial experience the good quality of the gym equipment is an undeniably strong plus.

Review Title: Pure Gym Wincheap is an increasing‚Ä¶
Review: pure gym wincheap is an increasing disappointment and i have been a member for several years. class timetable is virtually non existent, the equipment is tired and decidedly dirty, the environment is similarly unsanitary and the staff are basically in a rotating door. the new staff are virtual children and have little experience and no expertise in social skills, let alone teaching skills. this can mean that health and safety is an issue, as the necessary checks, demonstrations and correction of how to use equipment etc is not happening. the staff spend most of their time looking at their phones, even while running classes and virtually have no engagement with the customers at all. the model employed by pure gym does not work. as the instruction teams are quickly [mostly virtually] trained in a short time frame, thrown in to a site, they have no experience and little confidence, are desperate to get enough pt sessions [of which there are not enough to make it viable for most of them] and therefore they very quickly end up leaving. management is often poor and the sites are often neglected; dirty changing rooms, overflowing sanitary bins, lack of cleaning equipment, no toilet rolls ‚Ä¶ despite raising concerns over and over again and even meeting twice with regional management ‚Ä¶. it is the same old story. once kingsmead reopens in their updated and upgraded building .. i will be returning there. by the way, several other members [and exiting staff] share the same, if not more scathing views of both the system and the club. really a poor choice, if you are considering joining.

Review Title: Showers disgusting and unhygienic - risk of Legionnaires
Review: showers disgusting and unhygienic  hopefully this is not going to get another pure gym thanks for your feedback we take all feedback on board generic response, because this is important.  the showers are not cleaned, many are out of order. there is layers of mold around the seals and on the ceiling tiles. there is a real risk that from this gyms compliancy around cleaning and maintenance that legionnaires disease could form and harm members. i request that pure gym take this on board and get adequate testing and cleaning undertaken.  as others have already mentioned, the showers in the male changing room are also either out of order, or of poor quality. currently 3 are out of order with no eta on fixing, with out of the remaining 4, 1 is of satisfactory working, the others do not spray water properly, and is often cold.  parking is also another problem, again pure gyms generic response is that they are working on it. how hard is it to put or pay for a parking eye or other devices. or a member of staff going out every 4 hours and noting number plates down who have been there.

Review: i have been going to castle mall‚Äôs puregym since early 2020. the gym there is absolutely fantastic, excellent atmosphere, high-quality equipment and people.  as a very happy customer i decided to add a secondary gym to my subscription as the one in riverside is now closer to where i work.  unfortunately to my surprise all the machines (cables-pulleys) are of a different brand than the ones in castle mall. older, of lesser quality and with heavier weights. now, this isn‚Äôt the end of the world and i know that different brands have distinct mechanisms/angles/calibrations making them feel different. however, when i subscribe to another puregym i expect the same level of equipment and quality, not a downgrade.  this probably happens in a lot of other puregyms across the uk, and some people might not mind it, but for me it really throws off my routine and makes it hard to focus on improvement. what‚Äôs the point of paying for a +1 access when i have to change my whole workout schedule/weights as the machines feel like they belong to a complete different gym chain.  i think it would be beneficial if puregym could provide a more consistent experience across all its locations. that way, i can rely on the same weights and machines, and i can focus on improving my shape instead of wasting time trying to adapt to different equipment.  i honestly feel torn to write this dissatisfying review as i will happily remain a pure gym customer, however i will not visit again nor recommend the one in riverside over the one in castle mall. especially to someone like me who wants to use both/switch.

Review Title: Worst Puregym I've visited in MCR
Review: after 5 years as a puregym member, this is the third puregym im a member of and by miles the worst one. ive been here for a good few weeks and apart from in classes (that are ran on the middle of the floors as there are no studios), im yet to see a staff member. the gym and the equipment is outdated and doesnt allow for much flexibility or variation in your workouts. no kettlebells, no slam balls, no prowler sled, no room to do weighted walked lunges or barbell hip thrusts, no skiing machine and whoever planned the layout of this gym did not think it through at all. you cant bring weights around so if you want to do weights, youll be crammed into a tiny space downstairs where theres about 5 benches as theyve decided to cover the top floor with cardio equipment and make it lool like theyre still practicing social distancing - the use of space is that poorly planned. even if its cheaper than both market street and exchange quay which i have previously been a member of, its not good value for money like the other 2. market street feels smaller but its much better equipped and always has staff around. i went for this one as ive always been very happy at puregym but will now look elsewhere in stretford as this gym is so limited. i like to do my own circuit training and combine weights and cardio but its not possible here. its weights downstairs and cardio upstairs. very poorly planned with little innovation. its old school and doesnt have the best room for a fun workouts.

Review Title: Too many people on phones not working out taking up space
Review: pure gym is cheap and there are branches everywhere. this is the positive.the negative: having been to leeds, liverpool, twickenham, reading, and a few more there is one consistency: poor maintenance, and poor ventilation.  i am also fed up with people coming to the gym with a tripod to not work out but to flex on social media. this isnt policed, and the staff dont care. i do as its not legal to film without consent and when someone is pretending to lift, and filming me actually sweating, it gets on my nerves.  i have mentioned it to managers but they did not know that it is in fact illegal. pure gym, its time to educate staff, and kids who go to the gym to watch youtube on the bench should get a new hobby.

Review: very disappointed with the refurb, after weeks of disruption, it is finally finished. there is now no obvious route to walk to get to the change rooms. you now have to negotiate around weight machines and folks waiting for the machines, not a safe environment, especially for visually impaired folk. the best cross trainer machines, with the variable footbed angle, have all been taken away and not replaced. the remaining machines that are upstairs face the wall by the entrance, creating a cramped, uncomfortable exercise experience. as has been previously mentioned, there is no privacy in the change rooms as its now open plan, and in the name of reducing energy consumption (reducing costs) the temperature of the showers has been turned down to the point that they are cold ü•∂ and almost impossible to stand under after a workout. pity they didnt have a deep clean during the refurb. oh, please stop leaving the covers off the drains in the showers ü§¢

Review: the gym is really well stocked with equipment, clean and the staff are generally very friendly and polite. when it is actually open its a good gym. however, the gym is frequently closed due to a range of different issues. in the past month its been closed for two weeks due to drainage issues. other issues in the past twelve months which have resulted in closure or partial closure of certain parts of the gym range from no aircon, no lighting, no hotwater, drainage issues or the front doors not working. puregym offer use of other nearby gyms at these times, but st pauls for example is not equivalent in terms of equipment, cleanliness or towel service. building issues seem to take ages to resolve, which is becoming tedious the extra membership cost for this gym over others in the nearby area is really not value for money if you cant access what you are paying for.

Review: about 2 months ago, i arrived at the gym to find that the women‚Äôs toilets were all out of order which is a monthly occurrence here due to all the mentally impaired people who work out here - clogging it with their sanitary towels among other things. it was no surprise.  i went up to management, needing to go to the bathroom. they informed me that they would accompany me to the male toilets to which i replied ‚Äúi‚Äôd rather not as those will be filthy‚Äù. she reassured me that they had been cleaned ‚Äúthoroughly‚Äù by staff, ready for women to use. i followed her to the male toilets, waited by the cubicles (both were in use). someone came out,..walked past her and me without washing their hands. once again not surprising, simply disgusting. i went to the bathroom, came out after touching the door handle which has probably never ever been cleaned since this place opened and headed to the sink. pressed on the soap machine, and there was no soap. despite the manager confirming that it has all be sorted etc. i turn to her and say ‚Äúthere‚Äôs no soap‚Äù she then turns to a locker to see if there‚Äôs soap stored there. there is not. i‚Äôm standing there in shock and mind boggled - thinking ‚Äúwhen was the last time they even filled this up‚Äù. i would also like to mention this was at 5pm during rush hour. supplies should be doubled for that time. it was evident that she lied. the toilets were not clean, there was no soap and every single man who went into that bathroom could not wash their hands so they were just spreading their toilet infested hands all over the gym equipment. in addition to this, the antibacterial pumps are far and few between. 9/10 are empty whether that be at the entrance or down in the weights area.  i headed back to the women‚Äôs lockers to find out that people had forced their way into 2 out of the 3 toilets and tried flushing and flooded the whole bathroom. sewage just floating around. what a great start. bacteria not only on my hands but also in the air. what an absolute disgrace.  i‚Äôm not sure what is worse but having the manager lie to your face about the ‚Äúthorough‚Äù clean that was done is honestly pathetic.  if there is another pandemic,..i‚Äôm sure it‚Äôll spread nice and quickly here.  bring your own wipes, gel and soap cos they sure won‚Äôt have it here.

Review Title: Ok'ish, but could be SO much better with some effort
Review: classes run at this gym are generally demanding and well run by some excellent staff. however, the changing room facilities are nearly always lacking. the changing facilities for women are poorly maintained - shower number 3 (of 5)has been out of use to a poorly fitting glass door, for over 3 weeks causing delays from queuing. the one and only soap dispenser has been broken for 2 weeks and falls clear of the wall when use is attempted. when asked three days ago if this had been reported, a female cleaner replied yes but had no idea if/or when it may be mended. many days see the floors unclean with assorted rubbish and mess which gives a poor impression. there seems to be no "members internet" which makes individual training less attractive as tv etc cannot be viewed...(there are no screens on any machines, so no chance to watch anything at all, unlike many other gym groups. all-in-all, with some extra effort and attention by the pure gym group, broadstairs gym could be very good indeed, but at present it has to do better before i give a top score... hopefully, i will be able to do so soon

Review Title: Not what it says on the tin
Review: gym facilities are good but it‚Äôs a 24/7 hour gym sat in a 6am-10pm car park. for the average user that is probably no problem but i have a very busy life and need to go the gym from 5am. i have already been given a parking ticket and have had to chose between not going or going when it‚Äôs open. not only have i had to reschedule my whole day/ life around fitting in this time slot but it‚Äôs at the busiest time of day. i haven‚Äôt seen the live numbers below 113 people when i‚Äôve been in there which again adds time to my workout. the staff and equipment could be the best in the world but for placing it where it is completely takes away the one thing that stands the gym out from the rest. i do not feel i should have to find alternate parking and walk to a place i pay monthly for; it‚Äôs preposterous. there are no other gyms around that are convenient to use for me so until this is sorted out the gym in my opinion is completely useless. if you are going at more sociable hours then nothing in particular makes this gym stand out as being any better. it‚Äôs very busy all the time, sometimes hard to get the machines/ equipment you want without waiting, sometimes a substantial amount of time. better off supporting a local family run gym where complaints like this will be duly noted and taken into action. pure completely refuse to try and make any changes to the situation. currently reviewing the situation with the third party parking company

Review: the gym is great, as are the shop floor staff. but the company is morally bankrupt and only out to claw as much money from customers as possible. all over their website it talks about flexible packages, the ability to change as required. the reality is if you want to upgrade (give them more money) the process is simple. but downgrading is not possible without cancelling your direct debit (i have experienced this and a quick google tells me i‚Äôm not the only one). when you try downgrading on the website, they take you through a circle of web pages right back to where you started. when i contacted customer services i received a response of ‚Äúit‚Äôs easy to downgrade, click here‚Ä¶‚Äù taking me straight back to the circular process again. they caveat this message with ‚Äúif this process doesn‚Äôt work, you can cancel your direct debit‚Äù (you didn‚Äôt need to tell me, i have‚Ä¶). another really sad example of corporate greed trying to get one over on their (loyal) customers. frankly i have better things to do than mess around with cancelling direct debits only to then go through the whole sign up process again (with a setting up fee!), only for them to take advantage of me again.  update: following the response from puregym (below) i have copied in part of an email chain from customer services which demonstrates that they don‚Äôt easily downgrade memberships at customer requests, and they do recommend cancelling direct debits:  ‚Äúthank you for your message.  we are sorry you feel that we are "spouting lies" when informing you of our cancellation process.  also mentioned in the previous email is the information "if youre having issues this way its nothing to worry about, you can also cancel by ending your direct debit agreement with your bank"  this issue can be resolved by contacting your bank directly and cancelling the direct debit.  we are unable to cancel the membership on behalf of a member otherwise i would do so for you.  we are here to Review Title: Your customer service process is a JOKE!
Review: why dont you guys have a phone line?  ill be honest the gyms are great, i love the gyms. my issue is the customer service operation. how can a company raise millions in funding but cannot afford a working phone line operation to help customers? i made a mistake whilst signing up yesterday, and wanted to change my email address. when i called the number i found online, i was told to email or dm using social media. it was annoying, but i needed help so i did it.  i then reach out via social media to be told somebody will be getting back to me in 12 hours. 12 hours? in 2023 it takes 12 hours to reply to a message? what the hell?  to my shock it is now almost 24 hours since ive messaged and ive received no reply. ive had to now do my own research to reach out to specific members of member services to get my query sorted.  there is no excuse to not have an active phone line. microsoft teams is there for a reason. ringcentral, zoom, anything. i work in an office for an online company and guess what? we have lines which people can reach us on. its not hard to do that. even if for some strange reason you dont want to speak to customers on the phone, an online chat function would work too. your customer service process is complete rubbish (i cant swear on here or else i would) and needs overhauling or else you will start to lose people.  24 hours and counting for a simple request? for a company of your size? in 2023? do better.

Review Title: The gym is full of underage people
Review: the gym is full of underage people. ive been a member of your westwood cross gym for around a week or 2 now and although i love the gym and the facilities, i have really thought about cancelling my membership and going elsewhere. the gym itself is great its just the number of underage kids youre allowing in the gym. i went with my nephew who is a 6th form student (17) and was pointing out so many kids who were below the age of 16 who attend his school. sometimes you go in there and its like a community centre for children just loitering around the machines. i have nothing against anyone who is genuinely trying to work out but you can see a lot of them are just there for somewhere to hang out.  in the changing rooms this evening there was a group of 4 or 5 just sitting in there smoking vapes. i had to get into an argument with them to move so i could access my locker.  ive seen them doubling up in the booth you have to enter to get inside the gym.  i watched 2 girls basically rounding round the gym screaming tonight almost like a playground.  i understand the gym is unstaffed at certain times but i feel like you need something in place so more regular checks are being made for this.

Review Title: What is going on with the Muswell Hill PureGym
Review: dear gym management, i regret to inform you that i have had a rather disappointing experience at your gym, and unfortunately, i cannot recommend it to others. despite my initial enthusiasm, i have found that your management seems to have little interest in addressing member inquiries or concerns, and your staff are treated poorly. i have observed several instances of abusive behaviour from your staff, which is unacceptable and unprofessional. in addition, the facilities seem to be neglected and not adequately maintained, with equipment often broken or in need of repair. as a paying member, i expect a certain level of customer service and attention to detail from the management of a gym, and i feel that this has been lacking in your establishment. i have attempted to bring these issues to your attention in the past, but unfortunately, it seems that my feedback has fallen on deaf ears. i hope that in the future, you will take steps to address these concerns and provide a more positive experience for your members. until then, i will be taking my business elsewhere. sincerely thomas

Review: been a member now for just over a year. the gym is kept very clean, staff are friendly, and the machines ok. however, like others here, i feel that the water temperature has been turned down too much recently. this is a false economy, as to keep the shower just above lukewarm, you have to keep the water flowing continuously. i guess all companies need to make savings at present, but puregym have gone too far with the water temperature - a few degrees warmer please!  update may 2023 puregym seem to have taken note of the complaints and responded by raising the temperature of the showers (a couple of weeks ago). not to previous levels, but to an acceptable shower temperature. they have also shortened the length of time the shower flows when the button is pushed from 30 seconds to 20 seconds, which is fair enough. i have therefore raised the star rating of this review.  update 05 june 2023:- puregym certainly know how to p*ss-off their membership! a new revamp of the website has now removed entirely your attendance record, the only thing i used to use it for! it is now just advertising and trying to get you to upgrade. back down to 3*

Review Title: Used to be great. Needs an update, lacking in comparison to other gyms in the area.
Review: been going to this gym over 18 months and sadly, its going downhill. i dont know if theres a suggestion box, but know a few (especially female) members are feeling the same recently.  the weights area needs an update, especially in comparison to other puregyms and gyms in the area. theres two squat racks, one powerlifting platform, and two smith machines but understandably theyre very popular. theres only four 6ft barbells but they belong to the two squat racks, one powerlifting platform, and one bench press, so you feel bad stealing them. plates are hard to find and usually all over the place. the smith machines are ancient, they don‚Äôt even go all the way to the ground.  theres no hip thrust machine like other gyms or any space if you want to hip thrust or deadlift away from a squat rack. youd literally just be in the middle of the space and in the way. even if they invested in a hip thrust bench and barbell pad it would be better than nothing.  womens section has nothing in it but cardio and abductor machines. if the two spaces by the mirrors and two benches are taken, loads of women just have to workout in the middle of the room because theres a big ab mat holder in the only other decent space.  it has the potential to be an amazing gym but needs to be looked after a bit better, definitely falling behind. lately, there has been 50+ people in there from 7-10am, so gets quite busy which is great for peoples wellness but difficult for space. would be great if staff could consider updating equipment/layout.

Review Title: Removal of cleaning supplies but increase in membership fee...
Review: i am really disappointed at the removal of the cleaning station on the ground floor. only one paper towel dispenser has been left at the far end by the free weights. it is insufficient for everyone that uses the equipment on that level and shows no consideration for anyone using the cardio equipment. not to mention can be quite an assault course to grab a paper towel and get back to the other end whilst trying not to disturb, trip over or get hit by people in the middle of their own workouts (the folks using the free weights are by no means in the wrong). i imagine they are just as annoyed by having to watch out for the increased foot traffic.  having asked a few friends who use pure gyms elsewhere ive found this seems to be a hq directive which baffles me. yes covid is now much less of a concern but surely that should have proven how important cleanliness and hygiene is. removing right after announcing a price increase too, not a great look.  please rethink this. its so important to have the ability to clean equipment before and after use.  the gym itself is ok, during peak times there are queues for equipment but nothing i wouldnt expect elsewhere and the staff are very helpful. if i was rating just in those areas my rating would be much higher.

Review: this will be an interest read for anyone who has only seen pictures online etc and want a genuine understanding from someone who has been there multiple times. this gym lacks pretty much everything. the only strength i can give it is that it‚Äôs open 24 hours. firstly, it lacks machines which is fine if it were like most other puregyms and didn‚Äôt exceed 220+ people a day. it‚Äôs rather funny considering there‚Äôs about 3 stretching areas and massive, empty walkways for no apparent reason so there‚Äôs plenty of space to add machines. a lack of machines is one thing, but a lack of cable hooks is just embarrassing. honestly, you would laugh if you go there for the first time and realise there‚Äôs about 6 cable stacks/pull downs which are simultaneously without hooks, meaning the manager and co clearly didn‚Äôt pay enough attention to planning.  secondly, and more importantly, the clear lack of hygiene. someone else wrote a review concerning this and the response triggered me to also write one. trying to uphold a ‚Äúsustainability‚Äù record is not an excuse for not providing cleaning equipment like every other gym does. it doesn‚Äôt matter how good you claim your cleaning regiment is, it won‚Äôt fix the fact that 20 different people have used the same bench before me and none had access to cleaning tools‚Ä¶ i‚Äôll talk about the sinks later.  thirdly, the staff, particularly the manager, lack respect. good luck trying to enjoy a peaceful workout with her around. constantly threatening the entire gym for someone to own up to placing a dumbbell in an incorrect area or what-not. with all due respect, it‚Äôs a commercial gym. no one really cares where the dumbbells are placed as long as they‚Äôre re-racked, particularly during busy hours. maybe you could get angry at things like this when you fix the basic problems of your gym first like the sink design. the priorities are completely mis-prioritised. i‚Äôd be far more concerned with how poorly your sinks are designed that your hand is literally touching the floor of the sink whilst you‚Äôre washing (which yes, is the definition of counter-productive as you‚Äôre literally re touching everything which has been washed off‚Ä¶)  really bad gym, certainly the worst puregym in the radius. however, if you‚Äôre a casual who turns up to a class once a week and doesn‚Äôt really interact with any weightlifting equipment, go ahead.

Review: i received an email from puregym banbury on thursday advising of "intermittent hot water in club." the email went on further to advise me that "you will have access to puregym bicester." so not having had any further advice from puregym banbury, i went along to puregym bicester. i found that my code didnt work on the doors but luckily, thanks to puregym bicester actually having staff available, i was let in, having showed the email to the staff member. props to him for that! i found puregym bicester to be better supplied with equipment. i completed my workout and left. i checked my phone and i found two emails from amy jubb of puregym banbury, with the message that my pin number doesnt allow access to puregym bicester. i then found a third email advising me that "routine maintenance has now been completed and hot water has been restored", signed by puregym banbury cross retail park. its a shame that puregym banbury had good intentions but failed to deliver on their offer. this comes down to staff not updating their customers on the current status of their gym. they update the door code but fail to update their customers. all of which makes their original offer of alternative gym use useless. i did give feedback already to puregym via the app, but have yet to receive a response. if i could rate puregym bicester separately id give them five stars.

Review Title: Filthy showers and changing areas, broken machines.
Review: the biggest issues are cleanliness and items and exercise stations not being repaired or replaced. it is the lack of cleanliness which disappoints most however. piles of rubbish are often left outside changing rooms. the showers are often filthy and there is mud on all the stairs, changing areas by lockers and even on some machines. the toilets are often unusable and there is no obvious attempt to rectify the situation.  regarding machines which are out of order, they are often left for weeks with out of order stickers on. indeed, even the main electric entrance doors are out of order and have been for weeks, meaning there is only one entrance in and out.  this gym has only been open for barely 3 months. if this is how the facilities are to be maintained, the future at sevenoaks puregym doesnt look good.

Review: i have been a puregym member since 2015 and always enjoyed my sessions at my local gym and never had any issues until recently when i just wanted to request changing my home gym and wanted to speak to somebody. i called the number which directed me to their email address. i then sent an email in which case i was given a standard automated response, so i emailed back to request a human response. 2 weeks on no one emailed me, i visited my home gym to speak to a manager but each time i went there was a notice saying that there was no manager onsite? i finally sent a message on facebook messenger to my home gym with my number requesting a callback from a manager or customer services and again 5 days on i have heard nothing!! i have been a paying member for 8 years and never stopped my direct debits although since covid i have been absent from the gym for 3years i still kept my membership going. all i wanted to do was change my home gym since there is another gym closer to me and i cannot access it until i speak to someone. in my opinion this is bad customer service and since i have worked in retail myself for 23 years i am shocked that this still happens in the digital world we live in. if this isnt resolved by the end of this month then im afraid i will be forced to cancel my membership with puregym and join the gym group or jd gyms which are also local to me now. i hope i dont have to do this and puregym can get in touch and keep me as their customer.

Review: the gym is an absolute mess! filthy gym , the machines look like they never get wiped down as every time i use a machine they are full of dust and grime. the floor around the machines looks like it never gets a hoover let alone a mop. my treadmill and step mill is always full of rubbish  full of  old paper towel and wrappers. one of the treadmills (the one on the left )stops working if you put the speed up high. the dumbbell area is very dirty, underneath each dumbbell is full of bits and dirt! ive seen other gyms use a steam cleaner on the dumbbell area or maybe just a wipe down would be ok. not enough machines for the volume of members. having one seated leg extension and one hamstring curl isnt good enough. the gym needs more cables as they are very busy and there isnt enough to go round. likewise having just one pec dec machine is ridiculous considering how busy the gym gets , need at least 2_3 of them. since i joined ive noticed a very bad smell near the handwash sink in the mens toilet, this smell is always there not sure if its a blockage or something. i only use this gym as its 2 mins from my daughters school and is handy after school run otherwise i wouldnt train there. before pure gym i trained at the gym group on kingsbury road and they are head and shoulders above pure gym in terms of cleanliness.

Review Title: Dont work for or at Pure gym...
Review: as an instructor at pure gym milton keynes winterhill, i find it appalling how i am being mistreated - being ignored when messaging or trying to contact both managers, no response. i have to chase them up literally to try get them to talk to me and sometimes they run off to the changing rooms or toilets to avoid me when i walk into the gym unexpectedly..  the managers cancelled my class with no reason, just because i tried to change the times of my classes due to other work duties that i have, i find this absolutey shocking and unprofessional as this defiantly wasnt my request!!!!!  i havent been properly getting paid for my classes since december, they owe me a lot of money and still not been paid for all my classes yet which i teach weekly..  im truly disgusted with this behavior and lack of professionalism at pure gym in how they take advantage of their freelancers...

Review: firstly, whenever someone posts an issue why do you insist members speak to the gym manager. this defeats the point of providing feedback. why do the club managers review the feedback posted and respond like they could before you moved feedback to trustpilot. my feedback consists of 3 points;  1. personal trainers not wearing uniform. had the policy changed, i thought they had to be in puregym uniform when training clients. i have recently observed several pts wearing their own clothing when training their clients. i think they should be in uniform especially if you still have a policy of non puregym pt staff not allowed to train clients in the gym.  2. pts not returning equipment. i have flagged this over the years. they should lead by example. i recently saw a pt get a step from the studio and use on the main floor with client and failed to return at the end. this is very frustrating.  3. more often than not the cleaning stations are overflowing, this morning at 7pm the bins were overflowing, only 1 dispenser had paper towels and only 1 spray had the cleaning solution. this is unacceptable. they should be cleaned and refilled at the end of the day.

Review Title: Too many groups. Not enough equipment
Review: this is not my home pure gym but i use this recently approx twice a month as regular visitor to sheffield. there is not enough equipment to cater for the amount of customers it allows in. there are too many groups of u18s using this gym and hogging the equipment meaning others cannot use it until 3-4 people have completed multiple sets. rethink capacity levels and behaviours for this gym otherwise you will lose customers. the standard of equipment is poor, most cardio machines are very old and the upstairs weights machines have variable resistance (i‚Äôm a regular gym goer and know what my level is). it‚Äôs almost as if the floor space in this gym needs to be completely rethought to best use the space. we all know that weight training is becoming increasingly popular and this gym needs to acknowledge this in provision of space and equipment. i have recently used sheffield city centre which has similar floor space but has much more modern equipment and more weights/cardio provision. one of the benefits of pure gym membership is being able to use multiple locations but the experience is not consistent and as a brand consistency of service is important.

Review: terrible. this gym doesnt compete to fire house fitness: its pointlessly spacious, the bathrooms stinks of faeces, some of the machines had a yellow mold, the weight floor had a pointlessly long half wall for no reason. there was only 6 different pieces of equipment for the weight area, most being cable machines, the shoulder machine is uncomfortable. the instructions on the shoulder machine are on the hinge that stands the chair up. the cable machines top hinge is way to short. now the cardio experience isnt as bad, but i did only use 1 machine because of the lack of quality in the weight area. the cardio bikes are just uncomfortable. they are just way too small and with a little weight it feels as if it will just fall flat on its side.  the weight machines had a weird amount of resistance, sometimes the machine would just slide up with little strength needed. even on higher weights that i shouldnt be capable of using, over time the resistance just felt weird, when using the rope for the triceps most of the resistance was putting the weight back instead of pulling it out.  i dont understand the hype, im guessing the reviews are from people that have never went to another gym, so they have no comparison, but even a home gym could do 1 better as at least you can keep it hygienic enough to not have a built-up cheese mold on a machine.  overhyped. if you want to take exercise seriously, go anywhere else.

Review Title: I would have given this gym a 5‚Ä¶
Review: i would have given this gym a 5 previously (been coming here about 4 years). it used to be the less rough/noisy/intimidating sister to london greenwich, the staff used to be so friendly & upstairs there was not loud music blaring. yeah those days are gone. i was there this evening the music was unbearably loud upstairs, last week there was a young man rapping at the top of his voice the whole time i was in there ( i could hear him clearly through noise cancelling headphones) and the assistant said not one word to him. theres so many things wrong that im cancelling. such a disappointment its become like london greenwich which is frightful.

Review Title: I wish I'd read the reviews‚Ä¶
Review: i wish id read the reviews before i signed up for a gym membership here as i certainly would have thought again. as others have said its all set up for body-building with only three exercise bikes, and all of very poor quality. most of the classes are all about weights too, and theres no spin classes which is important for me -  although there are a couple of very nice spin bikes on the gym floor and the puregym app has some great spin video workouts you could use - if only there was good wifi in the gym like you do get in other puregyms. all the cross-training machines are right next to each other - this is far too close and i think i may have caught covid from the man next to me who was coughing a lot. in the world we live in, nobody wants to exercise on top of strangers. as a semi-professional athlete any cold or virus can have devastating consequences for my training. as others have said, the male cleaner walking in and out of the open plan female changing room is a terrible idea - its feels creepy, and uncomfortable and i had to take to changing and showering at home before and after they gym. in addition, they advertise free parking, but two and a bit hours just isnt long enough for a good workout....

Review: i have been a member here for about 18 months and im afraid im seeing a slip in standards rather than a improvement and im looking for somewhere else to train. i fully understand you get what you pay for in life and certain times in the gym are busier than others and its a choice as to what time you go. but when your only window is around 430/5 this , unfortunately for me , seems to collide with school kick out times. the gym is swamped with kids/ teenagers id say between ages 14-17. all "training" in large groups, loitering around equipment , larking around , 5,6,7 of them at once. most not that interested in training , on their phones , chatting , not even in gym kit.  by the time the 6 of them have all had a little go , with the long group chats between sets , no exaggeration its 30/40 minutes before that equipment is available again.  the gym etiquette of these youngsters is none existent , to the point its almost funny. they all leave the gym without a drop of sweat on them . i dont overly have a problem with the kids , theres nothing else for them to do locally and if you dont know gym etiquette then how can you practice it.  my issue is the staff , gym managers and pts stood there seeing all this and doing/saying nothing. watching them leave equipment everywhere and just cleaning up after them. it screams of a place more interested in getting max numbers through the doors rather than a good training environment for all. im not suggesting kick them all out , we were all new in the gym once , but at least have a word as leaders in the gym to disperse the large groups and improve the etiquette. to summurise if your a new gym goer , can go weekday daytimes ,  or your a youngster looking for somewhere to hang out i would recommend this gym. but if you want any kind of intensive workout , your an immediate or advanced gym goer i really wouldnt recommend, it will just frustrate you and ruin it , your better off paying a bit more or travelling a bit further to get somewhere a bit more serious.

Review Title: Disgusting lack of standards of cleanliness
Review: the gym is large and so have up until now felt i can socially distance quite well. however the cleanliness is really poor since the ladies who used to work there have moved on. the toilets (shared gender) are repulsive all the time, even when theyve just been supposedly checked by the management on the rota. pubic hairs, urine and god knows what all over the bowl and seats. i dropped my water bottle on the floor and had to mop up with toilet tissue so the next person didnt slip and it came up black, i dont think the floors can ever have been mopped. the sanitising sprays have not been refreshed in months so unlikely will actually be useful when used to clean equipment and most of them have been empty completely since november. for someone who has an immune system problem these areas are very important and the gym managers just arent looking after customers (my review is not the only one mentioning cleanliness). to add to that the air smells stagnant and stale/ damp so although the air conditioning vents themselves are periodically cleaned the system needs a complete overhaul since were dealing with so many bugs and viruses this year. an absolute shame things have been left to slide this way, especially when vulnerable people like myself have found benefit of using. i think i will be cancelling my membership to be honest. fine if youre a gym goer who has no hygiene standards but otherwise youre best looking elsewhere.

1. gym is large

3. air smells stagnant and stale/ damp
Extracted Topics: gym is large | toilets are repulsive | air smells stagnant and stale/ damp

Review Title: Join at your own risk. Paid and not able to use gym
Review: i joined pure gym in bournemouth the triangle, only to attend the classes the 8/1, today the 15/1 i still cant use it. when download the app it would show that i had my membership cancelled in mallard rd and would not let me do anything. payment was done and d. debit set. i called them but they dont have customer service on the phone! even their phone number appears everywhere. contacted them on twitter where a bot answers and ask pin code. 7 hours later someone answers that they "helped me" transferring my membership to mallard rd!! exactly the opposite i was asking, so inconvenient and far away and more expensive and they "will charge the difference next month"! i told them that was wrong but never had an answer. i guess i will just have to cancel and ask for a refund as was not able to attend because of their own mistakes, if they dont refund me i will take the matter further. join a gym without customer service and dysfunctional app at your own risk.

Review Title: Claim to be 24/7 yet they close without warning
Review: signed up for a 3-day pass on the 23rd december to try the place out: seemed ok apart from some broken equipment like a rowing machine.  turned up the next day to find a paper note on the outside of a bi-fold door (which was only visible when the place was closed) stating it was shut after midday, would not be open christmas day and iirc closed on boxing day and new years eve/day.  not only a waste of most of my pass, journey time and fuel but there was no warning about this when i signed up, nor did their phone app mention anything about this.  total incompetence on their part and no sure whether i will bother with a full membership if this is how customers are treated.

Review: before the revamp, (sept/oct) you could find any number of girls and women at the back of the free weights doing barbell hip thrusts, all happy and content to set this up themselves. now following the revamp, there is no space to set them up but rather a thrust machine. i gave this machine a chance, but when i tried to stop my set i couldn‚Äôt get the weight and bar to lock which made me uncomfortable knowing i couldn‚Äôt stop a set whenever i began to struggle and wouldn‚Äôt be able to go to failure as i would have to lock the machine for a final raise. hip thrusts are a super simple exercise, so so basic and i don‚Äôt want to use a machine for them. simple as. i dont see the preacher curl stations being removed and forcing members to use the machine, the option is there. it‚Äôs so unfair to all of the paying members who want to set up, track the weight, and opt out safely of this exercise which often is performed with 80kg+ therefore the option to safely opt out is so important. i noticed another member move a box downstairs on the 6th of jan and set up the barbell and perform them the way she‚Äôs used to, then on the 7th i entered the gym and two big chest machines had been placed there, obviously to ensure there was no space for this practice to continue further. all i can say that is puregym is completely ignoring the wants and habits of its members. people are paying to go here and what you are offering as an alternative to thrusts simply isn‚Äôt good enough! you also say to go upstairs there‚Äôs a thrust area there- there‚Äôs a bench. with no barbell, no weights, just some weighted sacks, no one wants to use them. do you expect us to carry 6 plates and a barbell upstairs to use it instead?  i don‚Äôt know why this gym is being so adamant and stubborn about refusing to let people do thrusts which are a basic yet popular movement in a way that feels comfortable to them. why does it matter to you that much that you‚Äôd go out of your way to move equipment so people literally don‚Äôt have the space at all.  this is such a shame because i had noticed such an influx of girls doing them and i had hit so many pbs because the gym was so comfortable and well laid out but clearly you just see it as an inconvenience  additionally, the weights 1-10kg have been placed in the studio, i don‚Äôt think you realise this but this actually does isolate girls from feeling welcome in the gym, i just want to grab 7s to use with step ups on the box and now they‚Äôre in the studio which often has classes on.  all i can say is that i‚Äôm actually so disappointed you can see members habits and choose to completely isolate a group for the sake of what, either put some barbells and weights upstairs so girls can hip thrust, or keep boxes and some wall space free downstairs. there has to be a solution, we are the paying customers here and you‚Äôre making it feel like our workout is inconvenient.  i know i‚Äôm not the only one who feels this way as i‚Äôve overheard the manager be asked what‚Äôs happened and he‚Äôs stupidly choosing to back up the layout decision. surely if people are bringing down boxes you can see that the layout is the problem, not the workout. i hope to see a solution very soon.

Review Title: This review is only about the lack of air conditioning
Review: this review is only about the air conditioning problems at the gym. the trainers, classes, equipment, etc. are all wonderful. but after waiting years for decent air conditioning and air circulation, and living through months of disruption due to the refurbishment - the problem with air still has not been addressed. the new functional room is totally without a/c. it is a most unpleasant place to train despite the wonderful new equipment and setup. the main gym floor is also very stuffy and tends to smell. when one enters the gym via the pods one is hit with stale, heavy air and a putrid smell. the studio and spin room are pretty good, admittedly! thank you for that at least! at this time of year there are many new members due to all of the new years resolutions to get in shape. as a gym regular i hear many complaining as the gym is advertised as having a/c but it does not feel like that once inside. i have spoken with the lovely manager and it seems as if he cannot control the a/c. please may i ask that you look at this seriously and consider the health implications of training in hot, still air. thank you very much.

Review Title: Overall cant complain much due to the‚Ä¶
Review: overall cant complain much due to the price. although a few points that hopefully get back to puregym. - the equipment looks heavily used surprising for a gym that hasnt been open that long, think puregym needs to keep replacing equipment. - the benches are hard, so hard you end up slipping from one side to the other, maybe need to look at upgrading or getting a new supplier. - the gym is too cramped, they have a very large area just for classes which for a couple classes a day that are not even busy seems like a waste of space. - the gym needs a few more cable machines as this gets really busy and could do with a few more leg machines, but i understand space is tight. - weights section is ok but again a little cramped. - biggest problem is plates, people do not put weights back, you cant find a 20kg plate for some odd reason. there are so many odd plates in wrong sections. the staff need to make sure people put the weights back in the correct place, maybe a few signs in places so people can remember its simple gym manners. - they need to now limit the amount of members in the gym, its gets really busy and if more and more sign up then there will be no room to move. - the one in ashford is much better, hopefully they can get a bigger unit or do something about the space just too rammed.

Review: okay, folks, this is the review youve been looking for, strap in...   the good: 1. open 24 hours  2. it has become much less busy since jd opened, which is to the consumers benefit. perhaps around 90 people at peak time compared to 150+ prior to jds emergence.   the bad: 1. despite fewer heads in the gym, theres a ghastly smell around the free-weights area. having read some reviews, its evidently not a new problem and hasnt been fixed for a while. i can only imagine it getting worse if it isnt treated soon.   2. what in the monkeys is going on with the male toilets? why arent they ever clean? theyre never clean enough to use. this means dirty showers that are also almost see-through. if youre reading this and planning to join, be ready to hold for when youre back home.   3. puregyms music playlist is absolutely pump-killing. aint no way people are hitting prs with jess glynne - darling hold my hand.   4. theres nothing state-of-the-art about the exercise equipment. youll literally see them in every gym so dont let this be a determining point for you to choose puregym over another franchise gym. theyre literally all the same. puregym l&d is also looking to add more state-of-the-art equipment, but where are they going to put these? are you gonna leave any walking space?   5. the economics of the womens-only area will at some point or another annoy you. id say the ratio of men-women members is approx 15/1. i havent been in the womens area as a dude but i cant imagine more than 10 women in there at one given time. but its a decent size chuck of the gym (+ equipment) which the greater gender demographic is paying for but not able to use. surely there should be alternate pricing for women if its exclusive for them?   6. refreshments. it took me months to realise that there are vending machines in the gym. but, in good ol tradition, good luck finding them.   7. i havent heard a spin cycle class go on for about a month now. im sure after reading other reviews, youve uncovered another puregym l&d bonanza.   i can go on and on but to summarize, its a basic b!tch gym with nothing to brag about. if you want to go down to the pricing, jd is newer, cleaner and has more to offer and overall a better bang for your buck. unless youre local, it makes no sense to come to puregym l&d over jd.   stay blessed, ta!

Review: when i joined the burnham puregym it was ok as a budget 24 hour gym but over the last year it has got worse and worse. they claim its a 24/7 365 gym as displayed at the entrance of my local gym but this in fact is a lie because they randomly close for reasons like the queens death, xmas eve, xmas day etc... they should not be making false claims to deceive people. also recently they have began to turn the carpark lights off at night resulting in higher crime such as car break ins and cars being stolen, due to the lack of light their cctv cameras are deemed useless so the chance of catching the criminals is almost zero. during the day the heating is too high and at night it is off meaning its almost impossible to train due to the extremities of temperature. they also shut the main toilets at night which means that if the only disabled toilet is blocked as it has been for the last 2 days you are stuffed. i complained about the shower in the disabled toilet either being stone cold or very hot last january and after being passed around a few times nothing has been done as the mixer valve is still not mixing. the way things are trending i would not recommend pure gym to anyone and if things are not improved i will be moving elswhere

Review: pure gym luton dunstable. keep in mind this is a commercial gym. that said it is worlds apart from the milton keynes winterhill.  the good. open 7 days 24 hours, a good variety of weights and machines.  the bad. staff can be rude, air-conditioning is always hot first thing in the morning. often, no music. although open 7days 24 hours..... this year they have decided to close from 4pm christmas eve and re-open 8am boxing day. why when its unstaffed and others are open.  there is a ladies only part of the gym. this is new, and its a completely sexiest unnecessary waste of space. they have the prone leg curl, obviously men cant use that as men dont have hamstrings.  the ugly group sessions keep taking place in the functional area..... so thats 2 sections of the gym you cant use. there is a studio but obviously thats too obvious and the trainers must ensure all can both see and hear with the excessive loud music  new equipment installed, cable cross overs installed next to the wall. rendering part of it useless.  lack of mirrors, obviously to save on the already lack of cleaning that takes place.  often the racks in the functional area have the floor mopped, but plates are not moved so you end up with a puddle of water over plates, under them and the rack area becomes a claims direct slip hazard waiting.  hot water taps in the mens changing rooms......forget it. these are hold them down to keep water running and dont let go taps.  showers not sure if these are ever cleaned.  staff do not tidy up after the weak people that struggle to return their weights. it can be like a treasure hunt to find a dumbbell you want..... normally somewhere in the gym.  all in all its a gym. i prefer mk as its the complete opposite with good staff that has been their for years. where as ld has a high turn over of staff and managers. pure gym needs the correct management in ld and should look at mk as an example.

Review: i have been debating writing a review for a while given that i loved this gym but similar to the other recent reviews that have been left, unfortunately the gym has gone down hill very fast and something needs to change. as someone else mentioned, cleaning now seems to be non-existent, all but 2 of the mens showers are out of order, the showers that are in order never seem to be cleaned, the changing rooms also seem very grubby (the floor needs a deep clean for sure) and there is clearly something wrong with the drainage system given the bad smell that comes from the sinks. its a real shame as the gym itself is still fine but its now noticeable how things arent monitored anymore.  i still love this gym and i think that with a few improvements as highlighted above, it could be back to what it was. something just needs to change otherwise i feel members will be looking to join a different one. for the first time i have started looking around at other options. come on puregym help us out.
